 , electric vehicle chargers, batteries, electricity contracts, and our own
 **energy optimization software (VPP)** 
 . We are continuously working to develop new solutions that make a difference — both for our customers and for the climate.
   

  

 Application
   

  

* We will start reviewing applications immediately, so don’t wait to apply!
* On this page, you will find more information about our recruitment processes.
* For the final candidate, we conduct a background check on criminal records.


 We warmly welcome your application! ☀

title: Business analyst inom offentlig sektor
description:
Beskrivning av tjänsten
   

  

 På CGI ligger vi i framkant när det kommer till digitalisering och tillämpning av nya teknologier. Just nu söker vi medarbetare som delar vår passion och som har en erfarenhet som kravanalytiker.
   

  

 Vi söker en engagerad och erfaren Business Analyst med teknisk bakgrund inom offentlig sektor som kommer att spela en nyckelroll i att förstå, analysera och definiera krav för projekt inom offentlig sektor. Du kommer att arbeta nära både kunder och projektteam för att säkerställa att lösningarna lever upp till verksamhetens behov och mål.
   

  

 Dina framtida arbetsuppgifter
   

  

 I rollen som Business Analyst kommer du att ha en central roll i att stödja och utveckla våra IT-projekt och verksamhetsprojekt inom offentlig sektor. Din roll kommer att vara starkt kundinriktad, där du analyserar affärsbehov och formar skräddarsydda lösningar för att uppfylla deras krav.
   

  

**Dina ansvarsområden**
* Samla in, analysera och dokumentera krav från intressenter.
* Fungera som en brygga mellan verksamheten och IT.
* Skapa och visualisera kravmodeller, processkartor och användningsfall.
* Säkerställa att levererade lösningar möter de identifierade behoven.
* Bidra med insikter om trender och bästa praxis inom offentlig sektor.


 Kvalifikationer för att bli framgångsrik denna roll
   

  

 Du är en initiativtagande person som trivs i en snabbväxande miljö. Som en del av vårt team förväntas du vara självgående men samtidigt en lagspelare. Du har utmärkta kommunikationsfärdigheter och en naturlig fallenhet för problemlösning.
   

  

 Vi tror att du har en bakgrund inom datavetenskap, systemvetenskap eller annat relevant område och har mellan 3-5 års erfarenhet inom offentlig sektor. Du är även tekniskt kunnig och har förståelse för databaser och systemutvecklingsprocesser.
   

  

 Meriterande för denna tjänst är även om du är certifierad inom till exempel Scrum, SAFe, REQb.
   

  

 För den här tjänsten är det viktigt att du kan tala och skriva på svenska obehindrat. Eftersom våra kunder finns i offentlig sektor tillämpar vi även bakgrundskontroller.
   

  

 Vi ser fram emot din ansökan, har du några frågor om tjänsten är du välkommen att maila rekryterande ledare Lena Lundgren på Lena.Lundgren@cgi.com
   

  

**Låt oss som ägare omvandla verklig insikt till handling – tillsammans.**
 Livet på CGI bygger på ägande, lagarbete, respekt och tillhörighet. Tillsammans med oss kommer du att kunna nå din fulla potential.
   

  

 Du är inbjuden att ta ägandeskap redan från första dagen i vårt arbete med att förverkliga vår dröm om att skapa en arbetsmiljö där vi trivs med att arbeta tillsammans och bidrar till framgången för vårt företag. Det är därför vi kallar oss CGI Partners snarare än anställda. Vi drar nytta av vår kollektiva framgång och tillsammans får vi möjlighet att aktivt forma vår företagsstrategi och inriktning.
   

  

 Ditt arbete skapar värde. Du kommer att vara med att utveckla innovativa lösningar och bygga relationer med medarbetare och kunder samtidigt som du får tillgång till globala möjligheter att skala upp dina idéer, omfamna nya möjligheter och dra nytta av gedigen bransch- och teknikexpertis.
   

  

 Du kommer att forma din karriär tillsammans med ett företag som är byggt för att växa och bestå. Du får stöd av ledare som bryr sig om din hälsa och ditt välbefinnande och ger dig möjligheter att fördjupa dina kunskaper och vidga dina vyer.
   

  

 Bli en del en av världens största leverantörer av IT- och affärskonsulttjänster.

title: Engineering Manager - Payments
company_industry: Financial Services, Banking, and Technology, Information and Internet
description:
**At Billogram, we like to be the good guys of billing—making money when clients are happy and pay on time, rather than from missed payments.** 
 We believe it always pays off to treat people well. That’s why our platform for invoices and payments is built to remove pain points and instead be beneficial to both our clients and their customers— improving their relationships.
 



  





 To support our growth and become a leader in the European consumer billing market, we are looking for an
 **Engineering Manager** 
 to join our team.
 



  





**About the role:** 




 We’re looking for an experienced Engineering Manager with solid payments experience for a team within our Payments area. This is the perfect opportunity for someone who wants to balance leadership with hands-on involvement in our client projects. You will join the team in a defining period in time with all the possibilities to find new and joint ways of working.
 



  





**What you will do:** 



* Manage internal and external customers
* Plan and manage product and technical deliveries, ensuring clear and timely communication
* Challenge and grow a team of developers
* Continuously improve our ways of working
* Support product discovery



  





**What you bring:** 



* Experience creating high-performing teams
* A strong customer and commercial focus
* An understanding of how to create and measure value
* Knowledge about bank integrations and payment flows



  





**Who you are:** 




 You have a commercial mindset with a customer focus, and you thrive in a fast-paced environment. You possess the ability to deliver scalable products rapidly and with high quality while cultivating a high-performing team. You should have a general technical understanding, even if you don’t write code yourself.
 



  





**Why work with us?** 




 At Billogram we promise you an exciting journey as we break into new markets and grow at a rapid pace. That aside you will get lots of freedom and opportunity to develop together with great colleagues at our office, right in the center of Stockholm. We also offer flexible working hours, exciting challenges and a whole lot of laughs.
 



  





 We're committed to your long-term development, offering clear career progression paths. You'll also enjoy a fantastic benefits package, including 30 (+2) days of holiday, an occupational pension, a flexible wellness allowance, sick leave top-up, and parental leave compensation.
 



  





 At Billogram, our inclusive and diverse culture ensures that everyone can enjoy a fulfilling career and a great work-life balance. At Billogram, we provide equal opportunities and strive for an inclusive and diverse environment. All applicants will be considered for employment without attention to gender, transgender identity or expression, ethnicity, religion or other beliefs, disability, sexual orientation, or age.
 



  





**Welcome to the world of Billogram!**

title: Head of Asset Integration
description:
**⚡️ What We Do**
 Swiftly gaining ground as Sweden’s industry leader in battery storage and expanding rapidly in selected European markets, Flower is on a mission to enable the energy system of tomorrow.
   

  

 With an industry-leading AI-powered platform at its core, our service includes stabilizing the energy system by enhancing predictability and flexibility for both energy producers and consumers. By combining pioneering technology with a portfolio of flexible energy assets, we break new ground towards a fossil-free energy system, allowing clean energy to power society.
   

  

**🌟Who We Are**
 Tech company at heart – purpose in our DNA. Flower consists of a diverse group of innovative individuals with a strong desire to improve the state of the world.
   

  

 At Flower, we believe trust, collaboration and diversity are essential to not only create an inclusive work environment, but also drive career growth. By embracing varying perspectives, we allow creativity and progress to flourish.
   

  

 To accelerate towards our goal of becoming the pioneering force powering the energy system of tomorrow, we are now looking for a skilled Head of Asset Integration to join our Asset Management domain.
   

  

**👩‍💻 About The Role**
 As Head of Asset Integration, you will lead Flower’s Asset Integration team, comprising Technical Project Managers, Integration Engineers, and Software Engineers. Your mission is to ensure the team integrates renewable energy assets into our asset portfolio in a seamless and efficient manner. You will be responsible for setting strategic direction, fostering cross-functional collaboration, and ensuring our integration projects deliver both financial and societal value.
   

  

 This position may involve occasional site visits at different project stages. It is well suited for someone who thrives in a fast-paced, dynamic environment, and enjoys working at the intersection of technology, energy and sustainability.
   

  

**What You’ll Do**
* Define and execute the vision for integrating renewable energy assets, aligning technical initiatives with business objectives
* Lead, mentor, and inspire a multi-disciplinary team of technical experts
* Oversee complex integration projects, ensuring effective deployment of assets like batteries, solar, wind, and hydro within our grid portfolio
* Plan and adapt team size and structure to align with evolving project demands, ensuring optimal resource allocation and timely project delivery
* Work closely with internal and external stakeholders to drive process improvements and innovation
* Guide the team through high-level architecture and design decisions for system scalability, automation, IoT integrations to ensure robust, future-proof solutions
* Manage internal and external stakeholders, setting clear expectations and delivering projects on time and within scope


**Who You Are**
* A seasoned leader with a track record managing high-functioning technical teams
* You come with a rich technical background from renewable energy systems, asset integration, or a related engineering field
* Skilled in software development and IoT/hardware integration, with a noted ability to navigate complex, large-scale projects
* A strategic thinker and proactive problem-solver with some outstanding communication and stakeholder management skills
* Interested in the energy transition and committed to delivering sustainable solutions
* Experience within the energy sector—especially renewable energy or grid management—is highly desirable
* Proficiency in English


**📍 Location**
 Our beautiful office is located in the heart of Södermalm just a short walk from Slussen subway station. We encourage in-office collaboration but support a hybrid work model.
   

  

**✉️ Apply**
 If you’re ready to lead a dynamic team and play a key role in powering the energy system of tomorrow, we’d love to hear from you. Please submit your application in English detailing relevant experience.
   

  

 Throughout the recruitment process you will meet a People & Talent Partner, peers from your future team, VP of Asset Management, as well as our CEO.
   

  

 —-
   

  

*We kindly but firmly decline any engagement in recruitment assistance for our hiring processes. This includes partnership offers or the sale of recruitment tools.*

title: CRM Team Lead
description:
**About XBP Europe**
 XBP Europe is an innovative, forward-thinking provider of bills and payment process solutions. Leveraging an EMEA-wide footprint and proprietary technology and services, we are backed by decades of industry-relevant experience.
   

  

 Bills and payment processes are increasingly omni-channel and paperless. That’s where XBP Europe comes in. Our offerings enable seamless workflows and frictionless transactions. XBP Europe combines physical documents, digital data, and instant messaging to help organisations work smarter. As part of that, we help to gather, process, and refine valuable data for use in decision-making.
   

  

 Our digital transformation solutions enhance efficiency, cash flow, and end-user experience. We serve a growing client list throughout Europe. See why organisations of all sizes choose XBP Europe as a digital transformation partner, visit our website at www.xbpeurope.com
   

  

**Job Description**
**Follow Us** 
 : Stay connected with us on social media to see what working at XBP Europe is like.
   

  

 Linkedin, YouTube, X, Facebook or Instagram
   

  

**Promote CRM Team Activity**
**Client Management**
* Manage CRM and Service Management Teams in the delivery of the client relationship for customer on all issues, MI & SLA reporting, invoicing, resolution of issues and incidents new services etc.


**Account Planning and Governance**
* Ensure that account planning and strategic approach is taken appropriate to the client in collaboration with Sales and Solutions as required
* Ensure that account contractual governance is delivered to clients at the appropriate level


**Develop Client knowledge/understanding**
* Identify and up-date Client organization (charts, decision levels and process)
* Understand the services/solutions provided to the customer
* Understand and know contracts (incl. MSA) (documents library maintenance and up-date), validate if requested (incl. SLA commitment and billing item)
* Renew expiring contracts


**Profitability Review**
* Work with Finance / PLM and Deal Bid Review to analyze profitability of new ACV, existing contracts and renewals in line with business direction
* Escalate to management when decrease of revenue/profitability or in case of low or negative profitability
* Support escalations from finance to follow-up payments and collect debt aged invoices


**Customer Satisfaction**
* Maintain high levels of customer satisfaction - Communicate any client risks to the wider group. Ensure that service performance challenges are proactively progressed and escalated within the organization.
* Promote positive XBP new brand initiatives
* Promote positive customer perception
* Provide statistics and reports to client
* Prepare and attend client steering committees
* Prepare and participate to external audits (client’s audits)
* Be the main client contact when necessary (except production level issues, monitored by delivery manager or team leaders): information, tech or delivery issues, SLA breach & penalties, claims


**Base Refresh Growth - Exela solutions and services promotion**
* Promote services and solutions to customers
* Sell add-ons and/or new services
* Escalate sales opportunities to Sales team (if exceeding CRM scope)
* Analyse and validate customer needs, business watch/intelligence
* Be responsible of a customer portfolio and the related revenue : grow this revenue accordingly to personal objectives (Quota)


**Key Requirements**
* Excellent language skills in Swedish and English. Norwegian and/or Danish is beneficial.
* 3- 5 years of experience in Customer Success/ Client Relationship Management or similar roles preferably in IT industry


**What We Offer**
* Permanent Contract
* Paid Holidays
* Annual bonus plan
* Medical Benefits
* Social package and employee benefits at the corporate level
* Referral Bonus


**Disclaimer**
 XBP Europe prioritizes individual privacy and is devoted to safeguarding personal data. Our recruitment policy focuses on selecting the most qualified candidates based on merit and skills aligned with position requirements. Candidate information is handled in strict compliance with GDPR policies and relevant data protection laws. Read our GDPR policy here.
   

  

 XBP Europe is committed to creating a diverse environment. Qualified applicants will be considered for employment without regard to their characteristics or preferences. We provide equality, fairness and respect for all in our employment, whether temporary, part-time or full-time. We oppose and avoid all forms of unlawful discrimination including those known as protected characteristics.
   

  

 XBP Europe recruiters or representatives will only contact you by emails ending with xbpeurope.com or exelatech.com. We would never ask you for payment or ask you to deposit a check into your personal bank account during the recruitment process.

title: Controller Skanska IT - Stockholm
description:
Skanska Sveriges ekonomifunktion har som uppdrag att stödja samtliga verksamheter med redovisning och rapportering, styrning och analys samt ekonomiadministration. Vi söker nu en controller som kan stötta Skanska Sverige IT. Detta är en integrerad organisation inom Skanska som erbjuder IT-tjänster till hela Skanska Sveriges projekt-, affärs- och supportverksamhet. IT har en nyckelroll i Skanskas verksamheter och driver innovation genom digitalisering.
   

  

**Om rollen**
 Med verksamheten i fokus ansvarar du för att stötta i uppföljnings- och ekonomistyrningsfrågor, med fokus på värdeskapande, kvalitet och hållbarhet. Detta gör du tillsammans med dina kollegor inom Controlling Support gruppen samt i nära samverkan med verksamhetschefer inom Skanska Sveriges IT-organisation. Förutom arbetet med IT arbetar du tillsammans med kollegor inom funktionen Controlling Support för att förbättra våra arbetssätt, utveckla våra system, höja kvalitén på den ekonomiska informationen samt förflytta och utveckla oss som controllers.
   

  

 I rollen som Controller IT ingår att:
   

  

  

* Ansvara för Skanska Sverige IT:s ekonomiska rapportering och stötta verksamheten avseende prognos, budget och bokslutsarbete och med framtida investeringsbehov
* Arbete med uppföljning och prognos av leverantörer, licenser och avtal kopplade till dessa
* Arbeta med investeringskalkylering och förvaltningsprismodeller
* Ha en aktiv roll i IT:s ledningsgrupp och stötta dem i förändringsprojekt och upphandlingar med Business Case
* Driva förbättringsarbete avseende processer, metoder och verktyg för en ökad effektivitet och tydlighet


 Tjänsten är placerad i Stockholm. IT sitter på flera geografiska platser så resor förekommer.
   

  

 ,
   

  

**Den vi söker** 
 Vi söker dig som har ett intresse både för IT och ekonomi. Du vill arbeta med verksamhetsfrågor, drivs av affären och har en vilja att bidra med värdeskapande både utifrån verksamhetens- och ekonomifunktionens perspektiv. Du som person är förstås strukturerad och kommunikativ i ditt sätt att vara. Du gillar också att arbeta agilt och trivs i en föränderlig IT miljö. Du är självgående och tar gärna initiativ till egen analys och vill bidra till att utveckla och förbättra ekonomiarbetet inom IT. Här får du nytta av din sociala och pedagogiska förmåga som möjliggör ett effektivt samarbete med verksamheten.
   

  

 För att lyckas i den här rollen tror vi att du behöver:
   

  

  

* Minst sju års yrkeserfarenhet inom ekonomistyrning, controlling och/eller ekonomisk analys varav flera år inom IT Controlling är meriterande
* Erfarenhet av arbete med en IT organisation
* Högskoleexamen inom ekonomi
* Goda kunskaper i Excel
* Meriterande om du har erfarenhet av Oracle och Hyperion planning


**Välkommen med din ansökan**
 Varmt välkommen att ansöka med din CV, sista ansökningsdag är den 21 mars. Om du har frågor om tjänsten är du välkommen att kontakta rekryterande chef Julia Schwerdtfeger, på telefonnummer 0702-976516 eller e-post julia.schwerdtfeger@skanska.se
   

  

 Våra medarbetare är vår främsta styrka och det är viktigt att du känner dig trygg hos oss. Vi vill att du ska trivas på jobbet och ha kul med dina kollegor. Vi lovar dig som medarbetare en ständig kompetensutveckling och tillhandahåller en rad internutbildningar, befattningsspecifika program och internationella utvecklingsmöjligheter. För oss är hälsa och säkerhet extra viktigt och det ligger även som grund för våra förmåner till dig som anställd på Skanska.

title: Serviceminded kollega till MTRs internserviceavdelning
description:
**Arbetsuppgifter**
 Vi söker nu två kollegor till vår internserviceavdelning. Som kundservicemedarbetare på vår internserviceavdelning Servicecenter är ditt huvudsakliga uppdrag att på ett effektivt sätt hantera och kvalitetssäkra ärenden och felanmälningar som inkommer.
   

  

 Du ansvarar för att på ett professionellt sätt hantera kontakten med våra interna kunder och samarbetspartners. Du arbetar självständigt med ärenden men sitter tillsammans med ditt team om 3-5 personer.
   

  

 Dina huvudsakliga uppgifter är:
   

  

* Ta emot, registrera och sortera ärenden som rapporteras in till Servicecenter via telefon och e-mail från personal inom MTR.
* Övervakning av larm för stationer
* Ta emot och registrera sjukskrivningssamtal samt lösa vakanser
* Support för enkla IT ärenden
* Felavhjälpning av ärenden.
* Rapportera i ärendehanteringssystemet.
* Analysera och tolka rapporter
* Bidra till att utveckla och förbättra avdelningens rutiner och manualer.


 Vi annonserar två tjänster, varav båda är heltid och arbetstiderna är 06:20-14:20, rullande schema inklusive arbete varannan helg.
   

  

 Vi befinner oss i trevliga lokaler i Hagastaden, nära Odenplan.
   

  

 Vi tillämpar individuell lönesättning.
   

  

**Kvalifikationer**
 Arbetet på Servicecenter ställer krav på att du kan arbetar noggrant och strukturerat i många parallella processer samtidigt. En stor del av tjänsten handlar om att inhämta och koordinera information och samtidigt leverera den med god service.
   

  

 Vi söker därför dig som har flera års erfarenhet av att arbeta med service i miljöer där det händer mycket.
   

  

 För att klara arbetet ser vi att du har lätt att sätta dig in i system och förmåga att hantera information från olika källor. Du är en person som gillar att hjälpa andra och är serviceinriktad. Arbetet ställer höga krav på kommunikativ förmåga, vi ser därför att du har en mycket god förmåga att kommunicera på svenska och engelska, både i tal och skrift.
   

  

 Vidare har du
   

  

* Gymnasiekompetens eller motsvarande arbetslivserfarenhet
* Gärna erfarenhet av arbete inom kundservice och telefonsupport
* Mycket goda kunskaper i svenska, både i tal och skrift eftersom en stor del av arbetet innebär skriftlig och muntlig framställan
* Goda datorkunskaper och använder Office-paketet obehindrat


**Övrigt**
 Med oss på MTR gör du skillnad i människors vardag och för samhället omkring oss. Vi utmanar gamla sanningar och hittar nya lösningar för att utveckla oss själva och de samhällen där vi finns. Det har gjort oss till ett av världens ledande tågbolag. Våra värderingar är den röda tråden i vårt dagliga arbete: utmärkt service, ömsesidig respekt, ständig utveckling och mätbara resultat. De hjälper oss att skapa säkra resor, nöjda kunder och medarbetare som trivs. Vi är ett stort bolag vilket ger dig ett brett nätverk och möjligheter att utvecklas.
   

  

 Förmåner
   

  

 Som anställd hos MTR får du en rad förmåner, som SL-kort med resor i hela Stockholms län och Ticket Rikskortet till förmånsbeskattning. Förutom friskvårdsbidrag kan vi även erbjuda rabatter hos flera träningsanläggningar och företag inom friskvård.
   

  

 Vill du arbeta tillsammans med oss på MTR?
   

  

 Välkommen med din ansökan i form av ett CV och besvara ett antal urvalsfrågor. Har du frågor om tjänsten är du välkommen att kontakta Namn, Titel, via förnamn.efternamn@mtr.se. Ansökan sker via vår hemsida, vi har inte möjlighet att ta emot ansökningar via e-post.
   

  

 Urval och intervjuer sker löpande. Som ett led i rekryteringen använder vi oss av urvalstester.
   

  

 Varmt välkommen med din ansökan!
   

  

**Om MTR**
 MTR är en av världens främsta operatörer för järnvägsbunden trafik och har sin bas i Hongkong. I Sverige är vi över 3500 kollegor som driver tunnelbanan, fordonsunderhållsbolaget MTR Tech och MTR Facility Management. Vårt uppdrag är att underlätta människors vardag och länka samman och utveckla hållbara samhällen.
   

  

 För mer information om MTR besök www.mtrnordic.se .
   

  

**Anställningens omfattning**
 Anställningsform: Tillsvidareanställning
   

  

 Omfattning: Heltid
   

  

 Tillträde: 2025-05-01
   

  

**Ansökan**
 Ansök senast: 2025-04-08
   

  

 Referensnummer: C243155
   

  

**Anställning**
 Antal annonserade arbetstillfällen: 2

title: Business Development Manager
description:
Welcome to SSC – Swedish Space Corporation, the perfect workplace for those passionate about technology in general and space in particular.
   

  

 The Engineering Services division of the SSC has a longstanding record of supporting satellite and manned missions for both industrial and public sector customers. We offer comprehensive engineering and consultancy services across the full mission lifecycle, including satellite operations, science operations, ground segment engineering, system engineering and development and space safety.
   

  

 We are expanding our presence in the Swedish Defense and Space market, while continuing to support institutional, commercial, and NewSpace clients.
   

  

**Are you fueled by a passion for people and the ambition to create an awesome workplace? Are you ready to embark on an exciting journey with us to help Earth benefit from space?**
 If you answer yes to these questions, we invite you to seize the opportunity to make a significant impact as Business Development Manager in our team. We are looking for a dedicated team member who shares our core values of Customer passion, Care, Collaboration, Curiosity, and Courage.
   

  

**YOUR ROLE**
 We are seeking a Business Development Manager with a proven track record in the space sector, ideally with experience in project management and system engineering and/or background in Space Situational Awareness. The role will focus on developing business opportunities in Sweden’s defense and space industries while also supporting business development activities in broader institutional and commercial markets. Initially, the role may also include project management and system engineering tasks for running SSA projects.
   

  

 The successful candidate will identify new business opportunities, manage customer relationships, lead proposal efforts and will be able to fulfill a combined Business development and Engineering role.
   

  

 As a Business Development Manager, you will work with:
   

  

* Develop business strategy and market analysis
* Proactively identify and qualify new opportunities with a primary focus on the Swedish market.
* Lead and coordinate bid and proposal effort with technical teams
* Build and maintain relationships with key stakeholders
* Project management and system engineering for ongoing SSA projects.


**Who You Are**
 You are a proactive, independent, and results-driven individual with a strong engineering background, particularly in space safety. With expertise in orbital mechanics, space situational awareness, and surveillance technologies, you have a deep understanding of space safety regulations and industry standards (ESA, UNOOSA, etc.). You are comfortable managing and delivering SSA projects and have a track record in business development, securing contracts in the space and defense sectors.
   

  

 You bring excellent skills in proposal writing, negotiation, and client engagement, and have an established network within the Swedish and European space and defense industries. Fluency in both English and Swedish is essential, as is the ability to collaborate effectively across teams and communicate complex ideas clearly in both languages.
   

  

 You are organized, adaptable, and focused on high-quality outcomes, and you are willing to travel as needed for the role.
   

  

**What You Need To Know**
* University degree in Aerospace Engineering, Electrical Engineering, Physics, or a related technical discipline.
* Proven experience in business development and space safety within the space sector.
* Fluency in both English and Swedish.
* Proficiency in office and CRM tools.


**WE OFFER YOU**
* A unique opportunity to work with a variety of projects within the space industry.
* An excellent opportunity for personal and career development.
* An international workplace is characterized by an open atmosphere and a challenging work environment that continues to evolve.


  

  

**LOCATION**
 This is permanent position with 40 hours/week, located at Solna.
   

  

  

  

**NEXT STEP**
 If this opportunity sparks your interest, don’t wait—apply today! Applications are reviewed on an ongoing basis, and interviews will be conducted continuously. We kindly ask you to submit your CV when applying. While you are welcome to include a brief personal note or letter, our evaluation will primarily focus on your skills and qualifications as outlined in your CV, ensuring a fair and unbiased recruitment process.
   

  

 Please note that the job advertisement may close earlier than the stated deadline if we receive a high volume of applications. This allows us to ensure a fair and efficient recruitment process and give each application the attention it deserves.
   

  

 This is a security-classified position and will require a background check prior to employment.
   

  

**WE HELP EARTH BENEFIT FROM SPACE**
 Swedish Space Corporation (SSC) is a leading global provider of advanced space services, with more than 50 years of experience. We help space organizations, research institutes, commercial and institutional actors from all over the world to get access to space.
   

  

 With local presence on all continents and about 700 committed employees, we offer specialist expertise in satellite communications and satellite control services, spacecraft operations, rocket and balloon systems, launch services and flight test services, as well as engineering, operations and consultancy services for space missions.
   

  

 We help Earth benefit from Space.

title: SVT söker systemförvaltare för Topdesk och IFenix
description:
**Vad Vi Erbjuder Dig**
 Hos oss på SVT kommer du att få arbeta i en verksamhet som engagerar, berikar och berör. Tillsammans med engagerade kollegor kommer du att arbeta i en kreativ miljö som skapar historia. Du kommer att få en varierande och händelserik vardag samtidigt som du arbetar på ett av Sveriges mest kända varumärken. Här väntar ett team med en familjär känsla som ständigt lär av varandra. Du kommer också att få vara med i spännande initiativ och projekt för att SVT ska bli framgångsrik i sin digitaliseringsresa. Vi hoppas att just du vill vara med!
   

  

**Vad Den Här Tjänsten Innebär**
 Rollen innebär att förvalta, uppgradera och genom interna dialoger fånga in verksamhetens behov och kravställning för att sedan utveckla och optimera systemen Topdesk och iFenix tillsammans med leverantörerna. Du kommer att ha ett nära samarbete med många nyckelfunktioner inom SVT samt att vara kontaktperson mot leverantörerna. Topdesk är SVT:s centrala ärendehanteringssystem och hjärtat i vår interna support och servicehantering. Här hanteras supportärenden, felanmälningar och beställningar. Systemet innehåller även vår tjänstekatalog och en kunskapsdatabas. IFenix är vårt affärs- och uthyrningssystem som används för att hantera uthyrningsverksamheten av kostymer, rekvisita och möbler i SVT:s Magasin4. Systemet är avgörande för att säkerställa att våra produktionsresurser används optimalt och att vi kan erbjuda en smidig och professionell service till våra kunder.
   

  

 Som systemförvaltare kommer du, tillsammans med ett team systemspecialister, att ingå i gruppen Teknisk Support. Du kommer att ha viktig roll i att säkra att våra interna processer fungerar smidigt och effektivt, vilket i sin tur stödjer SVT:s övergripande mål att leverera högkvalitativt innehåll till våra tittare.
   

  

**Vem Vi Tror Att Du Är**
 Du har eftergymnasial utbildning inom teknik/IT eller några års erfarenhet inom IT/teknisk support eller IT/teknisk projektledning. Du trivs med ett omväxlande arbete, har en hög servicekänsla och god samarbetsförmåga. Vi tror även att du gillar att jobba målstyrt och är bra på att ta egna initiativ. Viktiga förmågor i denna roll är nyfikenhet och en förmåga att identifiera och implementera förbättringar. Du uttrycker dig väl i tal och skrift på såväl svenska som engelska.
   

  

**Du Behöver Ha Några Års Arbetslivserfarenhet Av**
* Att driva effektiva utvecklingsinitiativ
* Att utföra behovsanalyser och konkretisera krav
* Prioritering av backlogg
* ITIL


**Hur Du Ansöker**
 I den här rekryteringsprocessen använder vi oss av urvalsfrågor och CV i stället för att be om personligt brev. Det gör vi för att säkerställa att rekryteringen blir kompetensbaserad och effektiv och att vi får samma viktiga information av alla kandidater. Urval sker löpande så skicka gärna in din ansökan så snart som möjligt, men senast 21/3.
   

  

 Tjänsten är en tillsvidareanställning på heltid med placering i Stockholm och start enligt överenskommelse. Vi kan komma att tillämpa 6 månaders provanställning. Svenskt medborgarskap är ett krav då tjänsten kan komma att placeras i säkerhetsklass.
   

  

 Har du frågor om tjänsten är du välkommen att kontakta Joakim Kjellgren chef SVT Support mejl joakim.kjellgren@svt.se. Fackliga frågor besvaras av Maria Nassikas Unionen, Jonas Ohlsson SJF och Fanny Lindhé SACO. Samtliga nås via växeln 08-784 00 00
   

  

 Varmt välkommen med din ansökan!

title: Avdelningschef till Analysavdelningen
description:
**Är du en strategisk och analytisk ledare som vill fortsätta utveckla en av Sveriges mest dynamiska och kvalificerade analysavdelningar? Vill du arbeta på uppdrag av befolkningen och i samhällets tjänst för att analysera och utveckla välfärdssystemen i Sverige?**
**Om Pensionsmyndigheten och analysavdelningen**
 Pensionsmyndigheten har i uppdrag av regeringen att analysera ålderspensionssystemet och dess effekter för enskilda och samhälle. Kostnader, makroekonomiska konsekvenser, fördelningseffekter, äldres arbetsutbud, mikrosimulering, konsekvenser för arbetsmarknaden och den varaktiga ekonomiska tillväxten är exempel på analytiska perspektiv som kan finnas med i våra rapporter. Pensionsmyndigheten är expertmyndighet i analysfrågor och har i uppdrag att ta fram sakliga, objektiva underlag inför politiska beslut, men också för att öka allmänhetens kunskaper om pensioner och välfärdssystemen i stort.
   

  

 För att kunna genomföra myndighetens analysuppdrag har avdelningen stor tillgång och produktion av statistik och data, samt flera modeller och andra viktiga IT-verktyg. Avdelningen består av cirka 45 medarbetare fördelade på fyra enheter, datalager- och beslutsstödsenheten, statistikenheten, kapitalförvaltnings- och aktuarieenheten och utrednings- och försäkringsmatematiken. Medarbetarna har specialistkunskaper inom sina respektive ansvarsområden och många har arbetat länge inom analytisk verksamhet i sakområdet. Ett viktigt mål för avdelningen är att fortsätta utveckla samt fördjupa det analytiska innehållet i myndighetens rapporter.
   

  

**Om rollen som avdelningschef**
 Som avdelningschef ansvarar du för att tillsammans med dina medarbetare driva och utveckla myndighetens analyser och rapporter. Du leder avdelningens arbete med långsiktiga analyser och bidrar till strategiska beslutsunderlag för regeringen och andra intressenter. Du förväntas också företräda Pensionsmyndigheten i interna och externa sammanhang.
   

  

 Du är en del av myndighetens ledningsgrupp och bär ansvar för att utveckla hela Pensionsmyndighetens verksamhet. Du rapporterar till Generaldirektören, och har övergripande personal-, budget- och resultatansvar för avdelningens medarbetare. I ditt uppdrag arbetar du aktivt för att tillsammans med dina enhetschefer utveckla analysverksamheten, samtidigt som du skapar struktur och tydlighet i verksamheten.
   

  

 I rollen kommer du även att:
   

  

* Säkerställa högkvalitativa statistiska analyser och rapporter om pensionssystemets effekter.
* Driva utvecklingen och stärka myndighetens analytiska arbete.
* Skapa en strategisk riktning för analysarbetet och bidra till en förståelse av avdelningens ansvarsområden.
* Arbeta i ledningen för att omsätta myndighetens uppdrag och regleringsbrev i strategier och verksamhetsplaner.


**Din profil**
 Vi söker dig som är en analytisk och strategisk ledare med gedigen erfarenhet av att driva och utveckla verksamheter inom analys och statistik. Du har tidigare erfarenhet som chef samt dokumenterad erfarenhet av personal- och budgetansvar. Du har en förmåga att vara lyhörd och anpassa ditt agerande efter andras behov och perspektiv. Som person är du saklig och objektiv i dina resonemang och beslut. Din förmåga att sätta struktur och tydliga krav är god, likväl som att följa upp och utveckla en verksamhet med hög analytisk nivå. Vidare har du en god samarbetsförmåga och en vilja att arbeta tillsammans med andra för att nå gemensamma mål. Dina personliga egenskaper i rollen blir mycket viktiga och därmed något som vi kommer att lägga stor vikt vid.
   

  

**Vi söker dig som har:**
* Akademisk examen inom samhällsvetenskapligt ämne eller liknande, gärna nationalekonomi eller motsvarande.
* Gedigna kunskaper om välfärdsfrågor, ekonomi, socialförsäkringsfrågor, arbetsmarknad, pensioner eller liknande.
* Erfarenhet och stort intresse av kvantitativa analyser, datamodeller och statistiska metoder.
* God kommunikativ förmåga och vana av att företräda organisationen, internt och externt.
* Förståelse för statlig förvaltning och den politiska beslutsprocessen.


**Det är meriterande om du har:**
* Erfarenhet av att kvalitetssäkra och strategiskt utveckla analyser och underlagsrapporter.
* Forskningsbakgrund inom området.
* Kunskap inom försäkringsmatematik, kapitalförvaltning eller statistik kopplat till pensionssystemet.
* Erfarenhet av att leda genom andra chefer.


**Vad vi erbjuder**
 Ett viktigt samhällsuppdrag till nytta för hela befolkningen. Pensionsmyndigheten värnar om att våra medarbetare ska ha en god balans mellan arbete och fritid. Vi erbjuder flexibel arbetstid, möjlighet till distansarbete samt förmåner som friskvård, generösa semester- och pensionsvillkor. Vårt kontor ligger centralt i Hornstull, Stockholm, med närhet till tunnelbana.
   

  

**Bra att veta**
 Anställningen är tillsvidare och vi tillämpar sex månaders provanställning. Vissa tjänster kan placeras i säkerhetsklass.
   

  

**Din ansökan**
 Vi arbetar kompetensbaserat i hela rekryteringsprocessen och strävar efter en inkluderande, rättvis och objektiv urvalsprocess. Vi använder arbetspsykologiska tester för att säkerställa en träffsäker matchning.
   

  

 Har du frågor gällande rollen är du välkommen att kontakta rekryteringskonsult Mitra Frost. E-post: mitra.frost@novare.se Mobil: 0736-409239
   

  

 Har du skyddade personuppgifter? Kontakta ansvarig rekryterare så hjälper vi dig med ansökan.
   

  

 Vi ser fram emot din ansökan!
   

  

 #VårtJobbBerörAlla
   

  

 Anställningsform: tillsvidare med provanställning | Anställningens omfattning: heltid | Antal lediga befattningar: 1 | Sysselsättningsgrad: 100% | Ort: Stockholm | Län: Stockholms län | Land: Sweden | Referensnummer: PSL 2025-25 | Facklig företrädare: Anna Håkansson, ST 010-4542801, Anna-Karin Åhrman Cortelius, Saco-s 010-4543914, | Publicerat: 2025-02-26 | Sista ansökningsdag: 2025-04-03

title: Sales Advisor 30h - temporary contract
description:
**Job Description**
**WHAT YOU’LL DO**
 As a Sales Advisor at H&M, you’ll play a key role in creating an outstanding customer experience. You’ll welcome customers, guide them through your store, and support them in finding what they need while showcasing our products. Acting in line with our values, you’ll contribute to both your own success and the success of the company.
   

  

 You will:
   

  

* Share your fashion and product knowledge to help customers make informed choices.
* Collaborate with your team to deliver exceptional service at every step of the customer journey.
* Ensure the sales floor and back of house are well-stocked, organized, and inviting.
* Support with opening and closing of the store.
* Represent yourself and the brand positively during all customer interactions.


**Who You’ll Work With**
 Our stores are the heart of our company, where customers experience our brand firsthand. As part of the dynamic Store Team, every role—from Sales Advisors, Department Managers, Store Managers and Visual Merchandisers to Assistant Store Managers, Cash Office Responsible, and Delivery Responsible in larger stores—contributes to creating an inspiring and welcoming environment. You’ll also connect with the wider Area Team, collaborating across stores to share insights and drive success together. Alongside your team, you'll play a vital role in helping customers feel confident and express their individuality with the latest trends and timeless styles. By building meaningful connections with customers in our stores, we make fashion accessible and sustainable for all.
   

  

**Who You Are**
*We are looking for people with…*
* Experience in customer service within fashion, retail, or similar fields.


*And people who are…*
* Passionate about fashion and delivering an exceptional in-store experience while promoting our products and driving sales.
* Thriving in collaborative and dynamic environments.
* Communicative, creative, curious to work with store technology, with a strong eagerness to learn and develop.
* Flexible and action oriented.


**Who We Are**
 H&M Group is a global company of strong fashion brands and ventures. Our goal is to prove that there is no compromise between exceptional design, affordable prices, and sustainable solutions. We want to liberate fashion for the many, and our customers are at the heart of every decision we make.
   

  

 We are made up of thousands of passionate and talented colleagues united by our shared culture and values. Together, we want to use our power, our scale, and our knowledge to push the fashion industry towards a more inclusive and sustainable future.
   

  

**WHY YOU’LL LOVE WORKING HERE**
 At H&M Group, we are proud to be a vibrant and welcoming company. We offer our employees attractive benefits with extensive development opportunities around the globe.
   

  

* All our employees receive a staff discount card, usable on all our H&M Group brands in stores and online.
* In addition to our staff discount, all our employees are included in our H&M Incentive Program – HIP. You can read more about our H&M Incentive Program here.


**JOIN US**
 Our uniqueness comes from a combination of many things – our inclusive and collaborative culture, our strong values, and opportunities for growth. But most of all, it’s our people who make us who we are.
   

  

**This is a temporary position for 3 months during summer with the possibility of extension offering 30 hours per week with start in April or by agreement.** 
**This position is based in Mall of Scandinavia, Solna** 
 and you should be able to work during store opening hours. Basic language skills in Swedish or English is needed.
   

  

 We have an ongoing selection, so the position may be filled before the application deadline, so send in your application today!
 **The last application date is 26/3.**
 Take the next step in your career together with us. The journey starts here.
   

  

* Store roles assessment:


*To manage the high volume of applications for the Sales Advisor role, we use an online assessment method for skills-based recruitment within some of our stores. You will need to complete it as part of the application and screening process. Your responses will be scored by an assessment tool that applies predefined criteria set by H&M Group.*
*After completing the assessment, you’ll have the opportunity to share feedback and ask questions. If you experience any difficulties or prefer an alternative assessment method, please contact* 
*recruitment\_support@hm.com* 
*. Choosing an alternative will not impact on your application.*
*For more information on how we process your personal data, please see our Privacy Notice.*
* We are committed to a recruitment process that is fair, equitable, and based on competency. We therefore kindly ask you to not attach a cover letter in your application.

title: Domain Architect, Customer Solutions, Solna
company_industry: Transportation, Logistics, Supply Chain and Storage
description:
PostNord is the leading supplier of logistics solutions to, from, and within the Nordic region. We make everyday life easier by providing solutions for communications, logistics, distribution, and e-commerce. Our mission is to connect people and businesses reliably and efficiently.
   

  

 Customer Solutions is one of four Solution Areas within PostNord IT. We handle all customer-facing products, including the PostNord App, PostNord Business Portal and various customer APIs. Our product teams manage their products from start to finish.
   

  

 The Customer Solutions department at PostNord is structured to ensure efficient collaboration and innovation. The department is led by the head of Customer Solutions and includes various Product Owners and Technical Leads responsible for different aspects of customer solutions. This structure ensures that each area of customer solutions is managed by dedicated professionals who focus on delivering the best possible outcomes.
   

  

**Job Description**
 We are seeking a highly skilled Domain Architect to join our Customer Solutions department. As a Domain Architect, you will play a crucial role in designing and improving all aspects of our customer interactions working closely with various departments and development teams to ensure that our solutions are aligned with business goals and deliver exceptional customer experiences. This role requires a strong emphasis on collaboration and support, combined with the ability to set clear guardrails to guide the development process. You will report to Head of Customer Solutions and collaborate with Enterprise Architecture Team.
   

  

  

  

**Key Responsibilities**
* Provide technical guidance and mentorship to development teams and especially Tech Leads, fostering a collaborative and supportive environment.
* Collaborate with stakeholders to understand business needs and translate them into technical solutions.
* Lead the design and architecting of customer-facing applications by setting the target architecture for the domain and ensuring the architecture meets the business-needs, such as scability, security and user-friendliness
* Collaborate with Enterprise Architect team to drive the domain architecture board for decision-making, and lead the Customer Solutions organization in following PostNords standards, guidelines and guardlines.
* Stay up-to-date with industry trends and emerging technologies, incorporate them into the architecture as appropriate.
* Align with Cyber Security Department and address security questions within the department.


**Who are we looking for?**
**Qualifications**
 We are looking for you who has proven experience as a Domain Architect or similar role, ideally within a customer-focused environment. You should have a strong understanding of architecture frameworks and methodologies. Additionally, the following qualifications are required:
   

  

* Bachelor's degree in Computer Science, Information Technology, or a related field.
* Experience with customer-facing solutions towards consumers, businesses, and partners is required.
* Excellent communication and interpersonal skills, with the ability to collaborate effectively with both technical and non-technical stakeholders.
* Strong problem-solving skills and strategic thinking abilities.
* Familiarity with Agile Architecture and strategies for scaling Agile development is essential. This includes understanding how to adapt Agile methodologies to large-scale projects and ensuring that architectural practices support Agile principles.
* Excellent communication and interpersonal skills, with the ability to collaborate effectively with both technical and non-technical stakeholders.


 It is also meritorious if you have previous experience of Customer Relationship Management systems as well as knowledge of cloud technologies and modern software development practices. Experience in the logistics industry is also a plus.
   

  

**We offer you**
 Joining PostNord means becoming part of a dynamic and innovative team. You'll work in a supportive environment that truly values your contributions, offering generous opportunities for professional growth. Here, you can make a meaningful impact on both our customers' lives and the overall success of our business.
   

  

**Apply**
 Welcome to submit your application! The selection is ongoing, so please apply as soon as possible. If you have any questions or concerns, please email pontus.brohult@postnord.com.
   

  

 We look forward to hearing from you!
   

  

 Read more about our union representatives

title: Europe North Public Sector Leader, AGS
description:
***This job is with Amazon, an inclusive employer and a member of myGwork – the largest global platform for the LGBTQ+ business community. Please do not contact the recruiter directly.***
**Description**
 The Head of Public Sector is a senior leadership team role in Europe North, responsible for all operations of the AWS Public Sector business across the eleven countries of the Nordics, Benelux and Baltics. They are responsible for leading a multi-country, multi-layer organization of sales, technical and business development professionals who deliver compelling value propositions that drive cloud adoption across all government, education, healthcare, nonprofit organizations, and state-owned enterprises in the region.
   

  

 This manager of managers role reports to the Europe North Managing Director, and is responsible for end-to-end ownership of our strategy, go-to-market, and execution in the AWS public sector business for the region. The right candidate will be able to engage at the highest levels of government and will possess strong influencing and communication skills, with the business acument to navigate a highly complex regulator landscape across countries of different maturity.
   

  

 This role provides an opportunity to impact, engage, shape, bring innovation and grow the adoption of cloud computing within the public sector for the greater benefit of society and these countries.
   

  

 Key job responsibilities
   

  

 The ideal candidate will possess a senior customer leadership background that enables them to lead a diverse team of global sales leaders, customer account managers, partner and technical resources, engaging the broad public sector team.
   

  

 You will have the responsibility of mentoring and supporting the team so that pipeline and revenue quotas are achieved as well as defining territories and go-to-market strategy. Our growth will also mean that you will play an integral part with the growth and recruitment into the team.
   

  

* Develop strategic plans, set goals and quotas
* Hire and develop a multi-layer, multi-function orgnization, bringing in and cultivating the best talent in the industry
* Accelerate customer adoption and customer satisfaction, engaging at C-level or equivalent
* Work strategically with partners to extend AWS reach
* Collaborate with Senior Management, Finance, HR, Sales Operations, Sales Specialists, Marketing to align the team's initiatives.
* Conduct regular reviews of business and performance including pipeline reviews, prospecting and closing deals
* Present regular, accurate reports to senior management for review
* Identify and drive program and business improvement on a regular basis


 We are also open to hiring candidates to work out of one of the following locations:
   

  

* Amsterdam, Netherlands
* Stockholm, Sweden


 The successful candidate needs to be able to travel across the Europe North countries.
   

  

**About The Team**
 Diverse Experiences
   

  

 Amazon values diverse experiences. Even if you do not meet all of the preferred qualifications and skills listed in the job description, we encourage candidates to apply. If your career is just starting, hasn't followed a traditional path, or includes alternative experiences, don't let it stop you from applying.
   

  

 Why AWS
   

  

 Amazon Web Services (AWS) is the world's most comprehensive and broadly adopted cloud platform. We pioneered cloud computing and never stopped innovating - that's why customers from the most successful startups to Global 500 companies trust our robust suite of products and services to power their businesses.
   

  

 Work/Life Balance
   

  

 We value work-life harmony. Achieving success at work should never come at the expense of sacrifices at home, which is why flexible work hours and arrangements are part of our culture. When we feel supported in the workplace and at home, there's nothing we can't achieve in the cloud.
   

  

 Inclusive Team Culture
   

  

 Here at AWS, it's in our nature to learn and be curious. Our employee-led affinity groups foster a culture of inclusion that empower us to be proud of our differences. Ongoing events and learning experiences, including our Conversations on Race and Ethnicity (CORE) and AmazeCon (gender diversity) conferences, inspire us to never stop embracing our uniqueness.
   

  

 Mentorship and Career Growth
   

  

 We're continuously raising our performance bar as we strive to become Earth's Best Employer. That's why you'll find endless knowledge-sharing, mentorship and other career-advancing resources here to help you develop into a better-rounded professional.
   

  

**Basic Qualifications**
* Successful experience leading in a matrix environment across multiple countries
* People/sales management direct experience in a multi-tiered organization and experience managing technology-related sales teams with direct quota responsibility
* Direct and indirect sales experience in working with European public sector organizations (Government, Education, Healthcare)
* Experience successfully building and executing go-to market plans for medium and large enterprise accounts, leading, motivating and developing talent. Full Professional English level and any Europe-North languages is a plus
* Excellent written and verbal communication, presentation and analytical skills, accurate and concise reporting


**Preferred Qualifications**
* Extensive knowledge of AWS products and services
* A technical or educational background in engineering, computer science, or MIS
* MBA/MS degree in relevant field
* 50%+ Travel Time


 Amazon is an equal opportunities employer. We believe passionately that employing a diverse workforce is central to our success. We make recruiting decisions based on your experience and skills. We value your passion to discover, invent, simplify and build. Protecting your privacy and the security of your data is a longstanding top priority for Amazon. Please consult our Privacy Notice (https://www.amazon.jobs/en/privacy\_page) to know more about how we collect, use and transfer the personal data of our candidates.
   

  

 Our inclusive culture empowers Amazonians to deliver the best results for our customers. If you have a disability and need a workplace accommodation or adjustment during the application and hiring process, including support for the interview or onboarding process, please visit https://amazon.jobs/content/en/how-we-hire/accommodations for more information. If the country/region you're applying in isn't listed, please contact your Recruiting Partner.

title: Global Material Manager
description:
Join our Team
   

  

**About This Opportunity**
 Inbound Supply, a Group Supply unit, is accountable for the Design, Management, and Control of the Inbound Supply Chain to Manufacturing.
   

  

 We are now recruiting a Global Material Manager (GMM) with focus on Advanced Semiconductor category Dedicated IC (ASICs, FPGAs, Processors). The Global Material Manager has the responsibility for managing hardware component supplier base worldwide, securing both short and long-term material availability in the inbound supply chains. As GMM in Dedicated IC semiconductor domain, you will support Ericsson silicon strategy as well as key technology choices, by developing and implementing inbound supply strategies and lead the inbound supply work in your category. By establishing and maintaining relationships with suppliers on executive levels you will enable the right support level and prioritization from suppliers.
   

  

 Your role will be to ensure supply capability by ensuring preventive and mitigating activities, designing robust supply chains as well as securing correct dimensioning and maintenance of inventories throughout the supply chain, enabling high-level supply chain resilience. You will represent Supply in cross-functional category management governance and supplier selection fora.
   

  

**What You Will Do**
* Review supplier capability and commitment to Ericsson forecasts, analyse potential risks and opportunities and drive supplier improvements.
* Develop market sensing and business intelligence process for your suppliers and categories.
* Ensure resilience buffer targets are defined, using the appropriate buffer model, and implemented in the category/supplier dimension.
* Establish strong interaction with key stakeholders in the R&D, product management and Sourcing functions.
* Lead the development and execution of semiconductor strategy to support Inbound strategies, relationship management, and risk mitigation.


**The Skills You Bring**
* MSc degree in science or equivalent
* Outstanding semiconductor industry and ecosystem knowledge as well as semiconductor technology supply management practices, standards, and manufacturing processes.
* Excellent knowledge of Sourcing and/or Supply process and strategy practices
* RAN/Radio domain experience as well as Ericsson portfolio knowledge
* Ability to build and handle long-term relationships with suppliers on executive levels.
* Excellent communication and influencing skills.
* Strong leadership skills.


**Application**
 We look forward to your application with CV in English. We target 60% work-from-the office.
   

  

 Last day to apply is 2nd of April 2025. Please note that we do not accept, proceed, or respond for applications sent via e-mail.
   

  

 If you have specific questions, you are welcome to contact Raheleh Rouhani, Sr. Talent Acquisition Partner at raheleh.rouhani@ericsson.com
   

  

 Location: Stockholm, Sweden
   

  

**Why join Ericsson?**
 At Ericsson, you´ll have an outstanding opportunity. The chance to use your skills and imagination to push the boundaries of what´s possible. To build solutions never seen before to some of the world’s toughest problems. You´ll be challenged, but you won’t be alone. You´ll be joining a team of diverse innovators, all driven to go beyond the status quo to craft what comes next.
   

  

**What happens once you apply?**
 Click Here to find all you need to know about what our typical hiring process looks like.
   

  

 Encouraging a diverse and inclusive organization is core to our values at Ericsson, that's why we champion it in everything we do. We truly believe that by collaborating with people with different experiences we drive innovation, which is essential for our future growth. We encourage people from all backgrounds to apply and realize their full potential as part of our Ericsson team. Ericsson is proud to be an Equal Opportunity Employer. learn more.
   

  

**Primary country and city:** 
 Sweden (SE) || Stockholm
   

  

**Req ID:** 
 763084
   

  

 ]]>

PostNord is the leading supplier of logistics solutions to, from, and within the Nordic region. We make everyday life easier by providing solutions for communications, logistics, distribution, and e-commerce. Our mission is to connect people and businesses reliably and efficiently.
   

  

 Customer Solutions is one of four Solution Areas within PostNord IT. We handle all customer-facing products, including the PostNord App, PostNord Business Portal and various customer APIs. Our product teams manage their products from start to finish.
   

  

 The Customer Solutions department at PostNord is structured to ensure efficient collaboration and innovation. The department is led by the head of Customer Solutions and includes various Product Owners and Technical Leads responsible for different aspects of customer solutions. This structure ensures that each area of customer solutions is managed by dedicated professionals who focus on delivering the best possible outcomes.
   

  

**Job Description**
 We are seeking a highly skilled Domain Architect to join our Customer Solutions department. As a Domain Architect, you will play a crucial role in designing and improving all aspects of our customer interactions working closely with various departments and development teams to ensure that our solutions are aligned with business goals and deliver exceptional customer experiences. This role requires a strong emphasis on collaboration and support, combined with the ability to set clear guardrails to guide the development process. You will report to Head of Customer Solutions and collaborate with Enterprise Architecture Team.
   

  

  

  

**Key Responsibilities**
* Provide technical guidance and mentorship to development teams and especially Tech Leads, fostering a collaborative and supportive environment.
* Collaborate with stakeholders to understand business needs and translate them into technical solutions.
* Lead the design and architecting of customer-facing applications by setting the target architecture for the domain and ensuring the architecture meets the business-needs, such as scability, security and user-friendliness
* Collaborate with Enterprise Architect team to drive the domain architecture board for decision-making, and lead the Customer Solutions organization in following PostNords standards, guidelines and guardlines.
* Stay up-to-date with industry trends and emerging technologies, incorporate them into the architecture as appropriate.
* Align with Cyber Security Department and address security questions within the department.


 ,
   

  

**Who are we looking for?**
**Qualifications**
 We are looking for you who has proven experience as a Domain Architect or similar role, ideally within a customer-focused environment. You should have a strong understanding of architecture frameworks and methodologies. Additionally, the following qualifications are required:
   

  

* Bachelor's degree in Computer Science, Information Technology, or a related field.
* Experience with customer-facing solutions towards consumers, businesses, and partners is required.
* Excellent communication and interpersonal skills, with the ability to collaborate effectively with both technical and non-technical stakeholders.
* Strong problem-solving skills and strategic thinking abilities.
* Familiarity with Agile Architecture and strategies for scaling Agile development is essential. This includes understanding how to adapt Agile methodologies to large-scale projects and ensuring that architectural practices support Agile principles.
* Excellent communication and interpersonal skills, with the ability to collaborate effectively with both technical and non-technical stakeholders.


 It is also meritorious if you have previous experience of Customer Relationship Management systems as well as knowledge of cloud technologies and modern software development practices. Experience in the logistics industry is also a plus.
   

  

**We offer you**
 Joining PostNord means becoming part of a dynamic and innovative team. You'll work in a supportive environment that truly values your contributions, offering generous opportunities for professional growth. Here, you can make a meaningful impact on both our customers' lives and the overall success of our business.
   

  

**Apply**
 Welcome to submit your application! The selection is ongoing, so please apply as soon as possible. If you have any questions or concerns, please email pontus.brohult@postnord.com.
   

  

 We look forward to hearing from you!
   

  

 Read more about our union representatives

title: Sales Advisor 25h - Summer substitute
description:
**Job Description**
**WHAT YOU’LL DO**
 As a Sales Advisor at H&M, you’ll play a key role in creating an outstanding customer experience. You’ll welcome customers, guide them through your store, and support them in finding what they need while showcasing our products. Acting in line with our values, you’ll contribute to both your own success and the success of the company.
   

  

 You will:
   

  

* Share your fashion and product knowledge to help customers make informed choices.
* Collaborate with your team to deliver exceptional service at every step of the customer journey.
* Ensure the sales floor and back of house are well-stocked, organized, and inviting.
* Support with opening and closing of the store.
* Represent yourself and the brand positively during all customer interactions.


**Who You’ll Work With**
 Our stores are the heart of our company, where customers experience our brand firsthand. As part of the dynamic Store Team, every role—from Sales Advisors, Department Managers, Store Managers and Visual Merchandisers to Assistant Store Managers, Cash Office Responsible, and Delivery Responsible in larger stores—contributes to creating an inspiring and welcoming environment. You’ll also connect with the wider Area Team, collaborating across stores to share insights and drive success together. Alongside your team, you'll play a vital role in helping customers feel confident and express their individuality with the latest trends and timeless styles. By building meaningful connections with customers in our stores, we make fashion accessible and sustainable for all.
   

  

**Who You Are**
*We are looking for people with…*
* Experience in customer service within fashion, retail, or similar fields.


*And people who are…*
* Passionate about fashion and delivering an exceptional in-store experience while promoting our products and driving sales.
* Thriving in collaborative and dynamic environments.
* Communicative, creative, curious to work with store technology, with a strong eagerness to learn and develop.
* Flexible and action oriented.


**Who We Are**
 H&M Group is a global company of strong fashion brands and ventures. Our goal is to prove that there is no compromise between exceptional design, affordable prices, and sustainable solutions. We want to liberate fashion for the many, and our customers are at the heart of every decision we make.
   

  

 We are made up of thousands of passionate and talented colleagues united by our shared culture and values. Together, we want to use our power, our scale, and our knowledge to push the fashion industry towards a more inclusive and sustainable future.
   

  

**WHY YOU’LL LOVE WORKING HERE**
 At H&M Group, we are proud to be a vibrant and welcoming company. We offer our employees attractive benefits with extensive development opportunities around the globe.
   

  

* All our employees receive a staff discount card, usable on all our H&M Group brands in stores and online.
* In addition to our staff discount, all our employees are included in our H&M Incentive Program – HIP. You can read more about our H&M Incentive Program here.


**JOIN US**
 Our uniqueness comes from a combination of many things – our inclusive and collaborative culture, our strong values, and opportunities for growth. But most of all, it’s our people who make us who we are.
   

  

**This is a temporary position for 3 months during summer offering 25 hours per week with start in May or by agreement.** 
**This position is based in Västermalmsgallerian, Stockholm** 
 and you should be able to work during store opening hours. Basic language skills in Swedish or English is needed.
   

  

 We have an ongoing selection, so the position may be filled before the application deadline, so send in your application today!
 **The last application date is 2/4.**
 Take the next step in your career together with us. The journey starts here.
   

  

* Store roles assessment:


*To manage the high volume of applications for the Sales Advisor role, we use an online assessment method for skills-based recruitment within some of our stores. You will need to complete it as part of the application and screening process. Your responses will be scored by an assessment tool that applies predefined criteria set by H&M Group.*
*After completing the assessment, you’ll have the opportunity to share feedback and ask questions. If you experience any difficulties or prefer an alternative assessment method, please contact* 
*recruitment\_support@hm.com* 
*. Choosing an alternative will not impact on your application.*
*For more information on how we process your personal data, please see our Privacy Notice.*
* We are committed to a recruitment process that is fair, equitable, and based on competency. We therefore kindly ask you to not attach a cover letter in your application.

title: Informationsarkitekt till Riksbanken
description:
Brinner du för verksamhetsprocesser och informationsmodeller? Vill du arbeta med utmanande uppgifter i en spännande miljö där Sveriges ekonomiska utveckling står i fokus? Då är rollen som Informationsarkitekt till Riksbanken något för dig.
   

  

 OM ROLLEN
   

  

 Som informationsarkitekt på Riksbanken kommer du att ha en mycket viktig roll där du är med och driver ett omfattande och spännande förändringsarbete. Här finns stora möjligheter att göra skillnad och arbeta i olika konstellationer där du får chans att påverka och utforma arbetet samt din roll. Som informationsarkitekt ansvarar du för att omsätta verksamhetens krav till tydliga och effektiva informationsmodeller där arbetet utförs i nära samverkan med och stor förståelse för verksamhetens behov. Du kommer att utgöra en mycket viktig kugge i och leda vidareutveckling av vårt kompetenscenter för Enterprise Architecture (EA) där vi samlar och förädlar Riksbankens strukturkapital bl.a. process-, funktions-, informations- och systembeskrivningar.
   

  

**Exempel På Arbetsuppgifter**
* Leda och styra arbetet med informationshantering samt utveckla och förvalta informationsmodeller och -arkitektur genom att analysera, beskriva, och visualisera informationsmodeller, lösningar, strukturer, skeenden, och samband.
* Genomföra granskningar och bedömningar av leverantörers realiseringsalternativ samt säkerställa att IT-strategi, styrande principer och IT-riktlinjer efterlevs och utvecklas.
* Arbeta i datastyrningsteamet och vara en del av arbetet med att etablera, stödja och utbilda våra användare av vår nya data- och analysplattform.


 Vidare arbetar du med informations-, verksamhets- och IT-arkitektur på övergripande nivå men även operativt inom olika projekt. I ditt arbete samarbetar du med många delar av Riksbankens organisation. Rollen är en nyckelposition och syftar till att säkerställa att Riksbankens IT-stöd bidrar till att uppnå övergripande affärsmål och strategier, bl.a. genom aktivt deltagande i datastyrningsteamet som en del av Riksbankens arbete med data governance inom analysområdet. Du bidrar med din erfarenhet och kunskap och agerar rådgivare i frågor kring hur verksamheten kan utvecklas med hjälp av IT.
   

  

 OM DIG
   

  

 Vi ser att du är en positiv och drivande person som tar ansvar och är initiativrik samt van att arbeta mot mål. Du är strukturerad med god samarbetsförmåga och gillar att jobba som generalist med många kontaktytor till interna och externa intressenter. Noggrannhet och kvalitetsmedvetenhet är också mycket viktiga egenskaper. Du gillar att söka kreativa lösningar på problem i en positiv och entusiastisk anda. Du kan diskutera frågeställningar både med tekniska specialister och personer utan djup teknikkunskap.
   

  

**Krav För Rollen**
* Universitets- eller högskoleutbildning inom datavetenskap, systemvetenskap eller närliggande områden, alternativt arbetslivserfarenhet som vi bedömer likvärdig.
* Flera års erfarenhet av rollen som informationsarkitekt och mycket goda kunskaper inom informationsarkitektur.
* Erfarenhet av data governance.
* God svenska och engelska i tal och skrift.


**Meriterande För Rollen**
* Certifierad informations-, lösnings- eller verksamhetsarkitekt.
* Erfarenhet av modellering av processer, information och system samt erfarenhet av systemutveckling och systemutvecklingsprojekt.
* Erfarenhet av metadatahantering i datasjömiljö.
* Förståelse för kodande dataanalys med t.ex. Python.
* God förståelse av olika metoder för informationshantering.
* God förståelse av affärsprocesser, projekt- och implementationsmetodik.
* God vana av att dokumentera, presentera, leda möten och workshops.
* God kunskap och förståelse av olika Enterprise Architecture ramverk och metoder.
* Kunskap och erfarenhet av agila arbetssätt och DevOps.


 OM OSS
   

  

 Riksbanken är en myndighet under riksdagen. Genom att bli en del av Sveriges riksbank får du möjlighet att möta utmanande arbetsuppgifter i en stimulerande miljö och bidra till en central funktion för Sveriges ekonomi och samhälle. Om du drivs av att arbeta med meningsfulla och spännande uppgifter tillsammans med engagerade kollegor, ser vi fram emot din ansökan. Tillsammans bidrar vi till en stark och säker svensk ekonomi!
   

  

 MER OM TJÄNSTEN
   

  

 Tillträde: Enligt överenskommelse
   

  

 Anställningstyp: Tillsvidareanställning
   

  

 Placering: Centrala Stockholm, Huvudkontoret Brunkebergstorg
   

  

 Arbetstid: Förtroendearbetstid
   

  

 Möjlighet att jobba på distans: 1 eller 2 dagar i veckan
   

  

 Förmåner: Generösa semestervillkor, löneväxling till pension, subventionerad lunch i personalmatsal, friskvårdsbidrag, subventionerad massage och tillgång till gym och ledarledda träningspass samt tillgång till ett låst cykelrum i byggnaden.
   

  

 Tjänsten kan komma att placeras i säkerhetsklass och en säkerhetsprövning innefattande registerkontroll, säkerhetsprövningssamtal och särskild personutredning görs då för slutkandidaten. För vissa tjänster ställs krav på svenskt medborgarskap.
   

  

 ANSÖKAN
   

  

 Välkommen med din ansökan redan nu men senast den 11 april. I denna rekrytering samarbetar Riksbanken med IDG Recruitment. Om du har några frågor är du välkommen att kontakta Rekryteringskonsult Linda Wallin.

title: Natural Resources Underwriter_ Sweden
description:
**Company Description**
**JOB DESCRIPTION**
 Chubb is a world leader in insurance. With operations in 54 countries and territories, Chubb provides commercial and personal property and casualty insurance, personal accident and supplemental health insurance, reinsurance and life insurance to a diverse group of clients. As an underwriting company, we assess, assume and manage risk with insight and discipline. We service and pay our claims fairly and promptly. The company is also defined by its extensive product and service offerings, broad distribution capabilities, exceptional financial strength and local operations globally. Parent company Chubb Limited is listed on the New York Stock Exchange (NYSE: CB) and is a component of the S&P 500 index. Chubb maintains executive offices in Zurich, New York, London, Paris and other locations, and employs approximately 40,000 people worldwide. Additional information can be found at: www.chubb.com .
   

  

*In the Nordics we are an organization of 140 employees.*
**Purpose Of The Role**
 Chubb is growing and we are looking for a passionate Natural Resources Underwriter to join our team in the Nordics. In the role as Underwriter, you will focus specifically on Natural Resources.
   

  

 Are you ready for the next step in your career and would you prefer to take it in a fun and professional team at an international, renowned insurer? Then you are in the right place.
   

  

 This exciting role can suit an Underwriter who is hungry, motivated, inquisitive and in need of a new challenge. We will consider a similar minded hardworking person who feels ready to take the next step in the career.
   

  

 We require someone to develop and assist in underwriting Contractors All Risks and Power Generation risks associated with Natural Resources. Maintaining and building relationships with our Nordic brokers community with an ambition to write additional new business, which will be key to the success of this role, as well as growing the existing portfolio in line with our agreed growth targets, pricing, and retention budget.
   

  

 You make an impact and strengthen our market position by:
   

  

* Building and maintaining good relationships with brokers.
* Promoting our capabilities and building of a profitable Natural Resources portfolio.
* Strong commercial drive, always looking for new opportunities and value service and quality.
* Ensuring quality control by means of including underwriting and peer reviews.
* Representing and promoting Chubb to brokers and clients.
* Delivering strong service to brokers and clients, responding to cross-sell and new business opportunities and monitoring retention.
* Meeting the portfolio product line objectives for each underwriting year.
* Assisting in underwriting CAR/EAR and B&M LOBs to achieving underwriting profitability.


**Qualifications**
**Qualifications :**
* Fundamental understanding of and experience from underwriting processes preferably within construction , power generation or property underwriting, the insurance market, and competitors.
* Degree in Engineering or technical experience background with an interest for new technologies.
* A strong commercial drive and very customer-oriented approach.
* Experience from client servicing preferably from the insurance industry.
* Demonstrated skills in building and maintaining client relationships preferably from the insurance industry.
* Results driven, disciplined and ambitious with ability to work on own initiative.
* Good communicator and fluent in Swedish (or another Nordic language) and high level of English written as well as spoken.


**Why You Want To Work At Chubb**
* We offer a high-performance work environment in which appreciation and inclusiveness are of paramount importance.
* As an underwriter at Chubb, no two days are the same. You interact with various stakeholders and actively pursue opportunities. Where you do that? From our office in Stockholm, on location during meetings with clients/brokers or from your home office.
* At Chubb, the customer experience is key. With us, insurance is not a static product, but is continuously adapted to the needs of the market.
* As a Chubb employee, you are part of the world's largest publicly traded property and casualty insurance company, providing solutions to businesses of all sizes.
* At Chubb, we operate on the basis of trust. You have a high degree of autonomy, flexibility and also access to a multitude of training and development opportunities.


 If you have any questions, please feel free to contact
 **Anna Källs,** 
 Country Manager Sweden,
   

  

 anna.källs@chubb.com
   

  

 We look forward to hearing from you.
