title: Head of SAP CX Sales
description:
**Job Opportunity: Head of SAP CX Sales**


Are you ready to pioneer the transformation of sales channels in the Nordic region? Langia IT Solutions, a dynamic leader in the technology sector, is seeking a visionary Head of Sales to spearhead our journey towards becoming the foremost SAP Customer Experience (CX) partner in the Nordics.

 **About Us:**


Langia IT Solutions is at the forefront of revolutionizing customer experience and business processes through cutting-edge technology solutions. Specializing in SAP products, we are dedicated to empowering businesses to connect customer data, deliver personalized content, and craft seamless customer journeys. Langia has already taken a strong position in delivering Digital Commerce solutions based on SAP Commerce Cloud and is now gearing up to extend our service offering further and progress in the value chain to provide solutions that enable our clients to evolve into true, digital intelligent enterprises.

 **Why Join Us?**

* **Innovative Environment:**  

At Langia, innovation is our lifeblood. As a member of our team, you'll be immersed in a culture that fosters creativity, experimentation, and continuous improvement.
* **Impactful Work:**  

Lead the charge in shaping the future of sales channels across the Nordic region. Your efforts will directly contribute to transforming how businesses engage with their customers and drive revenue growth.
* **Professional Growth:**  

We invest in our employees' development and provide multiple opportunities for learning and advancement. As Head of SAP CX Sales, you'll have the autonomy to shape your role, build a team and expand your skill set.
* **Collaborative Culture:**  

Join a diverse team of talented individuals, many whom have a long history with SAP and former Hybris, are passionate about leveraging technology and driving meaningful change. Collaboration, respect, and teamwork are at the heart of everything we do.
* **Contribute to Company Growth:**  

You will join Langia at an exciting time where we are preparing not only for organic growth but where we are also looking into mergers and acquisitions within the SAP sphere and elsewhere to expand accelerate our growth trajectory. The environment creates ample opportunities to develop your own career and build up the organization.

  

**Your Role:**


As the Head of SAP CX Sales, you will be responsible for leading our sales efforts and driving business growth in the Nordic region. Your primary focus will be on establishing Langia as the go-to SAP CX partner, building strategic relationships with clients, and delivering tailored solution offerings that address their unique needs. You will work closely with cross-functional teams to develop and execute sales strategies, identify new business opportunities, and ensure the successful implementation of SAP CX solutions.

 **Key Responsibilities:**

* Develop and implement comprehensive sales strategies to meet or exceed the sales targets for SAP Customer Experience products.
* Lead, motivate, and manage the sales team to achieve top performance and sales objectives.
* Build and maintain strong relationships with key clients and stakeholders.
* Work closely with the marketing and product teams to ensure alignment on product positioning, key benefits, and target customers.
* Analyze market trends and competitor activities to adapt strategies and enhance the company’s competitive position.
* Provide detailed sales forecasting and manage the sales pipeline efficiently.
* Negotiate large-scale contracts and partnerships.

Represent the company at industry events, conferences, and professional associations to enhance brand visibility and network expansion.  
* 

**Requirements:**

* Proven track record of success in sales leadership roles, within the technology or consulting industry.
* Extensive experience with SAP Customer Experience (CX) solutions, including SAP Commerce Cloud, Emarsys, SAP Customer Data Cloud (CDC), SAP Customer Data Platform (CDP) and/or SAP Cloud for Customer (C4C).
* Strong business acumen and understanding of sales processes, customer journey mapping, and digital transformation initiatives.
* Exceptional communication and interpersonal skills, with the ability to build rapport and influence key stakeholders at all levels.
* Strategic thinker with the ability to translate client requirements into innovative solutions that drive business outcomes.
* Fluent in English and at least one Nordic language
* Bachelor’s degree in Business Administration, Sales, Marketing, or a related field. A Master’s degree is preferred.

 **Benefits:**

* Competitive salary and performance-based bonuses.
* Comprehensive benefits package including health insurance.
* Opportunities for professional development and career advancement.
* Flexible working conditions and the possibility to work remotely.
* Inclusive and supportive company culture.

  

**Join Us in Shaping the Future:**


If you're ready to take on a leadership role in a dynamic and fast-growing organization, we want to hear from you! Join us on our mission to redefine customer experience and unlock new possibilities for businesses across the Nordic region. Apply now and be a part of our journey towards building the modern, digital intelligent enterprise.

title: Marketing & Content Interns
description:
**Company Description**
 Devoteam G Cloud is an award-winning Google Cloud partner known for its innovative and collaborative culture. With a team of over 600 Google Cloud experts, we deliver cutting-edge solutions to businesses across the globe. Our Stockholm office is a hub for creativity and technological advancement.
   

  

  

**Job Description**
 We're looking for talented interns to join our team in
 **Stockholm** 
 this spring (
 **February - May 2025** 
 ). Are you passionate about content, SEO, and design? Or do you thrive in the fast-paced world of marketing and events? We have exciting opportunities in two key areas:
   

* **SEO & Content:** 
 Boost your skills in content creation, SEO, design, and event planning. Contribute to blog posts, social media content, website updates, and more.
* **Marketing:** 
 Dive into social media management, email campaigns, market analysis, and event coordination. Help us reach new audiences and promote our services.


  

  

**Qualifications**
* Currently pursuing or recently completed a degree in marketing, communications, business, or a related field.
* Excellent communication and social media skills.
* Basic understanding of SEO, analytics, and content creation.
* Strong teamwork abilities and eagerness to learn.
* Ability to create visual content (designs, videos, etc.) is a plus.


  

  

**Additional Information**
**What You Gain:**
* **Hands-on experience:** 
 Apply your skills to real-world projects and make a tangible impact.
* **Mentorship:** 
 Learn from experienced professionals and Google Cloud experts.
* **Networking opportunities:** 
 Build connections with leaders in the tech industry.
* **Cutting-edge knowledge:** 
 Gain insight into the world of cloud computing and the latest Google Cloud technologies.
* **Personal and professional growth:** 
 Develop your skills and confidence in a dynamic and supportive environment.


**Additional Information:**
 This is an
 
**unpaid** 

 internship opportunity based in our
 **Stockholm** 
 office.
   

  

**Apply Now!**
 Tell us which role you think you're best suited for (SEO & Content or Marketing) and submit your CV along with a motivational letter explaining why you're the perfect fit for Devoteam G Cloud!

title: Senior Technical Engineer - Store Payments
description:
**Job Description**
**About the team:**
 The Store Payments Enablement team is a key part of H&M’s Business Tech organization, operating within the Product Development & Engineering Center. Our mission is to deliver secure, modular payment solutions that balance cost efficiency with competitive time-to-market delivery. As a global team, we support card and alternative payment methods across all H&M stores, brands, and markets.
   

  

 Led by a dedicated Product Manager, our vision is to enable fast, secure, and frictionless payments. Driven by a passion for payment technology, we deliver best-in-class services for our customers and stakeholders.
   

  

**About the role:**
 As a Senior Technical Engineer, you will be responsible for the design, configuration, and development of new payment technologies to be introduced at H&M. You will work with a variety of payment technologies, including collaborating closely with Payment Service Providers, to deliver innovative, scalable, and secure solutions that enhance the in-store payment experience for our customers.
   

  

 Collaboration is central to this role. You will partner with teams across the organization, including those responsible for customer experience, core platform technology, technical infrastructure, and IT operations. Additionally, you will engage with Treasury, Cyber Security, Procurement, and Regional Teams to ensure alignment and integration of payment solutions with H&M’s broader business and operational objectives.
   

  

 In your role, you will combine your technical engineering expertise with deep business knowledge to design, develop, and integrate complex systems—both from vendors and in-house. You will support the full lifecycle of payment technologies, focusing on accessibility, optimization, and security. Your work will ensure the delivery of reliable, mission-critical solutions that create value for H&M's customers and the business, while continuously driving improvements to meet evolving needs.
   

  

**Responsibilities:**
* Technical Expertise & Vendor Collaboration: Act as a technical advisor in commercial negotiations, procurement, and escalations with Payment Service Providers (PSPs), Point-of-Sale (POS) vendors, and other partners.
* Requirements Gathering & Documentation: Capture and document both functional and non-functional requirements in collaboration with Business Experts, Retail Project Leads, Regional Teams and other stakeholders to ensure global and local needs are met.
* Development & Integration: Ensure the implementation, configuration, and integration of payment solutions with POS systems, PSPs, and internal platforms, supporting both legacy modernization and new technology adoption.
* Testing & Quality Assurance: Design, test, and validate payment solutions, maintaining test environments with payment terminals, networks, and integrations to support stability, scalability, and security.
* Problem Management: Identify, analyze, and resolve payment-related issues, including root-cause analysis of larger payment related problems in partnership with vendors and relevant stakeholders.
* Security & Compliance: Ensure all payment solutions adhere to PCI-DSS, GDPR, ISO, and other security and regulatory requirements, maintaining a secure and compliant payment environment.
* Technical Leadership & Knowledge Sharing: Serve as the team's technical subject matter expert, producing documentation, and driving best practices in system performance, automation, and analytics.
* Project & Stakeholder Engagement: Drive technical projects from inception to completion, engage with management and other key stakeholders on progress and achievements, and collaborate with cross-functional teams to maximize business value.


**Qualifications**
* Complex problem-solving skills with a focus on continuous improvement and innovation.
* Deep expertise in payment technologies and processes.
* Experience in designing platform architectures based on the latest payment technologies and innovations.
* Ability to work on technology-agnostic, high-performing, secure payment solutions that meet customer needs.
* Proficient in user testing, including automated testing, test case creation and deployment of technical solutions.
* Understanding of networking principles relevant to payment systems.
* Experience in researching and applying emerging payment trends in design, architecture, and engineering
* Strong knowledge of security best practices and compliance requirements (e.g., PCI-DSS, GDPR).
* Ability to work effectively both independently and collaboratively in multidisciplinary teams.
* Proven informal leadership skills, including managing dependencies and cross-team coordination with both technical and non-technical stakeholders
* Some project management experience, including tracking, reporting, risk management, and issue resolution is an advantage
* Familiarity with cloud technologies and cloud-based payment solutions is an advantage


**Additional Information**
 This is a fulltime permanent position. The role is
 **based in our office in Stockholm, Sweden** 
 .
   

  

 Apply by sending in your
 **CV in English** 
 as soon as possible. Due to data policies, we only accept applications through career page.
   

  

**Benefits**
 We offer all our employees at H&M Group attractive benefits with extensive development opportunities around the globe. All our employees receive a staff discount card, usable on all our H&M Group brands in stores and online. Brands covered by the discount are H&M (Beauty and Move included), COS, Weekday, Monki, H&M HOME, & Other Stories, ARKET, Afound. In addition to our staff discount, all our employees are included in our H&M Incentive Program – HIP. You can read more about our H&M Incentive Program here.
   

  

 In addition to our global benefits, all our local markets offer different competitive perks and benefits. Please note that they may differ between employment type and countries.
   

  

**Inclusion & Diversity**
 At H&M Group, we’re determined to create and maintain inclusive, diverse and equitable workplaces throughout our organisation. Our teams should consist of a variety of people that share and combine their knowledge, experience and ideas. Having a diverse workforce leads to a positive impact on how we address challenges, on what we perceive possible and on how we choose to relate to our colleagues and customers all over the world. Hence all diversity dimensions are taken into consideration in our recruitment process.
   

  

 We strive to have a fair and equal process and therefore kindly ask you not to attach a cover letter in your application as they often contain information that easily can trigger unintentional biases.
   

  

**Company Description**
 H&M Group is a family of brands; H&M, COS, Weekday, Monki, H&M HOME, & Other Stories, ARKET and Afound. At H&M Group, our people are the driving force behind our commitment to creating meaningful growth and more sustainable lifestyles. Help us re-imagine fashion and together we will re-shape our industry. Learn more about H&M Group here.

title: Regional Account Manager
description:
**Discover Trend**
 Trend Micro, a global cybersecurity leader, helps make the world safe for exchanging digital information. Fueled by decades of security expertise, global threat research, and continuous innovation, Trend Micro's cybersecurity platform protects hundreds of thousands of organizations and millions of individuals across clouds, networks, devices, and endpoints. As a leader in cloud and enterprise cybersecurity, the platform delivers a powerful range of advanced threat defense techniques optimized for environments like AWS, Microsoft, and Google, and central visibility for better, faster detection and response. With 7,000 employees across 65 countries, Trend Micro enables organizations to simplify and secure their connected world. For additional information, visit www.trendmicro.com
   

  

**Discover You**
 At Trend, we are always looking for top talent. We hire capability 1st, and you will work with the best. When you join us, you have direct access to any level, and freedom to make an impact and influence. With Trend Micro, you drive your own development. You are recognised for your passion to succeed, and can be the best part of yourself here.
   

  

 Discover your next exciting career opportunity….
   

  

**Regional Account Manager, Public Sector**
**Location: Sweden**
 Trend Micro, a global cybersecurity leader, helps make the world safe for exchanging digital information. Fueled by decades of security expertise, global threat research, and continuous innovation, our unified cybersecurity platform protects over 500,000 organizations and millions of individuals across clouds, networks, devices, and endpoints.
   

  

 Trend Vision One™ delivers advanced threat defense techniques, extended detection and response (XDR), and integration across the IT ecosystem, including AWS, Microsoft, and Google, enabling organizations to better understand, communicate, and mitigate cyber risk.
   

  

 Our Trend global threat research team delivers unparalleled intelligence and insights that power our cybersecurity platform and help protect organizations around the world from 100s of millions of threats daily.
   

  

 We have 7,000 employees across 65 countries, singularly focused on security and passionate about making the world a safer and better place.
   

  

 Trend enables organizations to simplify and secure their connected world.
   

  

**Responsibilities**
* Sell Trend Micro's products and services using a strategic sales approach, developing strong relationships with key individuals within named and prospect accounts.
* Drive quarterly business reviews with selected customers to ensure value from Trend Micro investment and ensure customers are kept up to date with Trend Micro product roadmaps, enabling customers to plan and mitigate risks to their business.
* Develop strategies and orchestrate company resources to maximize sales volume within assigned and prospect accounts.
* Effectively engage and build cooperative internal relationships with sales resources: SE, Channel, Specialist sales team and Leadership as required.
* Develop and maintain a robust sales pipeline and ensure full compliance with all internal processes.
* Provide accurate forecasts and reports on activity and sales performance.


**Experience**
* A proven track record of success selling in the Public Sector, (preferably in Cyber Security or related field), developing strategic customer relationships and winning new business.
* High levels of achievement against quota and experience selling to Senior IT and C-Suite personas.
* Experience selling SaaS products and services with an understanding of platform solutions.
* Can demonstrate strong sales skills and high level of technical and business acumen in both our industry and industry being sold into.
* Able to manage complex sales processes, selling complex solutions to medium and large enterprise customers.
* Experienced in a competitive field sales role selling direct to customers.
* Strong knowledge of and experience working within the channel and developing partner relationships.


**You Have**
* Minimum 4 years’ experience in an Enterprise Sales role.
* Ability to engage at the C level in a business benefits discussion.
* Previous experience or exposure selling Enterprise Security Solutions.
* Previous experience in selling IT security/ Infrastructure/ Software would be an advantage.
* Proven ability to achieve sales quotas in target market by selling and closing complex solution to end customers.
* Dynamic, results-oriented with a passion for over-achieving sales targets!
* Excellent interpersonal, negotiation and closing skills.
* Can-do attitude! We are looking for candidates passionate about their work and the cyber industry just as much as the experience you bring – a strong team and work ethic are paramount for success!
* Strong presentation & communication skills. English language skills are a must.


**Why Trend Micro?**
 Trend Micro provides equal employment opportunity for all applicants and employees. Trend Micro does not unlawfully discriminate on the basis of race, color, religion, sex, pregnancy and childbirth or related medical conditions, national origin, ancestry, age, physical or mental disability, medical condition, family care leave status, veteran status, marital status, sexual orientation, or gender identity.
   

  

 Trend Micro is a progressive employer with a very special and unique culture. Here at Trend Micro you will work with the best. When you join us, you have direct access to any level, and freedom to make an impact and influence. We expect leadership, not management. With Trend Micro, you drive your own development. We encourage thought leadership and advocate internal opportunity. Trend is like nowhere else. We embrace all of our differences and are motivated by challenge. We’re not just all about the money. You are recognised for your passion to succeed, and can be the best part of yourself here.
   

  

 www.trendmicro.com
   

  

 At Trend Micro, we embrace change, empower people, and encourage innovation in a connected world. Our diversity and multicultural workforce are key contributing factors to our success across the globe. We like to have fun while taking our culture seriously. We are an equal opportunity employer and are committed to this regardless of race, colour, religion, sex, nationality, age, citizenship, sexual orientation, marital status, gender identity or veteran status. We do not allow discrimination or harassment of any kind.

title: Internship: Information Security Specialist (Fall 2025)
description:
**Location:** 
 Hybrid or Remote
 



**Duration:** 
 Fall 2025, minimum of 8 weeks
 



 Are you ready to jump into the exciting and dynamic world of information security? Alva Labs is looking for a motivated and curious interns to join our Information Security team this fall. This is a fantastic opportunity to gain hands-on experience, work directly with our CIO, and help protect the integrity of a platform used by companies around the world.
 


**The company** 

 Alva Labs was founded in 2017 and offers a digital candidate assessment solution that helps over 600 companies worldwide drive more accurate and efficient hiring processes. Our platform provides Talent Acquisition Managers, Recruiters, and Hiring teams the insights to make confident and efficient hiring decisions while delivering a high-quality candidate experience. At the same time, we provide candidates with the means to demonstrate their full potential to employers.
 



 Security is at the core of what we do—our mission to modernize recruitment is deeply tied to safeguarding our platform and users’ data. This internship will allow you to dive into meaningful security projects and contribute directly to making our systems safer and more robust.
 


**What You’ll Do** 

 As an
 **Information Security Intern** 
 , you’ll work closely with our CIO and operations team, focusing on real-world security challenges. Your tasks will vary based on your interests, but they could include:
 


* **Security process improvements:** 
 Analyze and refine our existing security protocols to enhance system resilience.
* **Compliance and risk management:** 
 Assist in managing compliance requirements and assessing risk areas across our systems.
* **Hands-on IT-security work:** 
 Solve practical challenges related to IT-security in a cloud-based architecture.
* **Data protection and privacy:** 
 Contribute to safeguarding user data with best practices in data protection.



 We are also looking for an
 **IT Project Management Intern** 
 to join at the same time or in overlapping periods. While your primary focus will be security-related work, there will be opportunities to collaborate, share insights, and support each other on projects that connect
 **information security and IT process management** 
 .
 



 You’ll have regular mentorship meetings and support from experienced team members to ensure your learning is impactful and engaging. This is a fast-paced environment where your ideas and efforts will be valued.
 


**About You** 

 We’re looking for someone who is curious, eager to learn, and ready to take initiative. You don’t need to be an expert—interest and curiosity go a long way. We’ll provide the tools, support, and guidance you need to thrive.
 



**What we’re looking for:** 



* Currently enrolled in a
 **YH-education program** 
 (sv.
 *yrkeshögskola* 
 ) or a similar educational pathway that includes a mandatory internship component, ideally with a focus on Information Security or IT Security with a internship period of 8 weeks minimum.
* Proactive, curious, and willing to take ownership of tasks.
* A passion for information and IT-security.
* Comfortable working in a collaborative and fast-moving team.
* Fluency in English, no need to speak Swedish for this position.


**What We Offer** 
* **Practical experience:** 
 Work on impactful projects tied to real-world security challenges.
* **Tailored learning:** 
 Pick the projects and tasks that excite you the most.
* **Supportive mentorship:** 
 Receive regular feedback and guidance from experienced security professionals.
* **Impactful work:** 
 Contribute directly to protecting user data and improving security systems.
* **Growth environment:** 
 Be part of a high-paced SaaS company that values learning and innovation.


**Your future colleagues** 

 We are in total a team of 70ish people, representing 18 (!) different nationalities and a wide selection of professional backgrounds. And all of that is absolutely fantastic, but the true beauty is the trust and warmth you will experience. You will most likely never feel so supported and have so many brilliant brains to learn from and ask for guidance. To quote our CEO during our last company trip: “It feels like hanging out with a bunch of old friends”.
 


**Why join Alva?** 

 The problem we are solving is not just engaging and interesting (the combination of Psychological Science and statistics with a large chunk of candidate experience obsession – what’s not to love…?), but it is also something that has a tremendous impact on both people and businesses. You will have the opportunity to work with something that truly makes a difference.
 



 With 600+ customers, strong growth, happy users, and above 1 000 000 assessed candidates, there is a lot of greatness to build on. We are on an exciting phase of our company journey.
 



 What’s more? We have a hybrid approach, so working from home or at the office (or remotely within Europe) is your choice. You decide for yourself what works best for you.
 


 The process
 
 Does this sound like the perfect fit for you? We’d love to hear from you!
 


1. Objective screening with Alva’s own tests
2. Case survey
3. First interview
4. Final interview
5. Done deal!



 Take the first step toward an exciting career in information security—join us at Alva Labs and make an impact! 🚀

title: CLOUD PLATFORM SECURITY ENGINEER
description:
**About The Team**
 The Cloud Platform Team at SAS empowers product teams to build cloud-native solutions while enhancing the developer experience and providing a robust platform for innovation. We support teams organized in value streams across multiple products. Cloud Platform Team is divided into sub-teams that focus on different areas such as Cloud, Kubernetes and Developer experience.
   

  

 The Cloud Platform Team in SAS provides various capabilities to enable our product teams to build cloud-native solutions with greater developer experience and provide them with cloud platform to innovate. We support our product teams who are organized in value streams with several products. The Cloud Platform Team is segregated into several sub-teams which focus on different areas.
   

  

**Job Description**
 As a Security Engineer in the Cloud Platform Team, you will be responsible for designing, implementing, and overseeing security strategies, policies, and procedures to protect against potential risks and vulnerabilities. You will work closely with product teams and fellow security experts to promote security best practices and ensure our standards are met.
   

  

 In this role, you will lead the integration of security practices into the cloud infrastructure and throughout the software development lifecycle, aiming to minimize friction while strengthening the organization’s overall security posture.
   

  

**Challenges You Will Work On**
* Drive adoption of security practices like DDoS protection, CSPM, and Cloud Native Application Protection to secure cloud environments.
* Participate in disaster recovery planning and threat modeling to prepare for security incidents.
* Collaborate with Cloud Platform sub-teams to integrate security into cloud infrastructure services at every stage.
* Work with cross-functional teams to implement security best practices and adopt secure development practices, emphasizing “shifting security left.”
* Stay updated on cyber threats, trends, and technologies, offering recommendations to enhance security.
* Provide security guidance and training to Cloud Platform teams and stakeholders.
* Support compliance with regulatory requirements, audits, and information security policies.
* Foster a culture of security awareness across the organization.


**To Be Successful, We Believe You Have**
* Bachelor’s or Master’s degree in Computer Science, Software Engineering, or a similar field.
* 3+ years in IT security roles.
* Strong understanding of cybersecurity practices for protecting cloud infrastructure and applications.
* Hands-on experience with cloud security and application security best practices.
* Knowledge of cloud security frameworks (AWS, Azure, Google Cloud) and practices.
* Knowledge of Kubernetes and Containerization security best practices, tools and standards.
* Familiar with GDPR, NIS2, and ISO 27001/2 regulatory standards.
* Excellent communication and collaboration skills.
* Proactive problem solver with a data-driven mindset.
* Keen to expand knowledge and consistently enhance security practices.
* Team player with a positive attitude, passionate about cybersecurity.


**Why SAS?**
**Benefits**
 At SAS, we offer extensive opportunities for professional development in an international, fast-paced working environment. We are dedicated to the continuous growth of our employees. Working with us comes with a variety of benefits, including:
   

  

* Travel Perks: Enjoy discounted travel opportunities around the world with SAS.
* Health & Wellness: Access to health and wellness benefits, including a newly renovated gym with complimentary classes such as CrossFit and yoga.
* Discounts: Receive discounts from a wide range of brands, as well as on transportation to and from airports, airport shops, hotels, and car rentals.
* Work Environment: Our office location in Frösundavik offers a vibrant workspace with a restaurant, café, and easy access to outdoor activities in Hagaparken and Brunnsviken. Engage in running, tennis, outdoor gym sessions, kayaking, and stand-up paddling with equipment available free of charge.
* Convenient Commute: Benefit from a non-stop bus service connecting our office to Solna station, and commuter trains, alongside a network of cycle paths.


**Other Of Importance**
* Deadline for application: 28/03/2025. Please send us your CV as soon as possible, as interviews are conducted continuously and the position may be filled before the application deadline. Note that we are not able to handle any applications that are sent by email, due to GDPR.
* Desired startdate: As soon as possible.
* Position: Fulltime (100%) starting with a 6-month probation period.
* This position is based in Frösundavik, Solna (Stockholm), and you will be expected to work onsite. Remote work may also be an option, depending on the agreement made with your manager.
* To be eligible for this position you need a EU-work permit.

title: Cloud Engineering Manager
description:
This role is an opportunity for a technologist with a passion for Linux and Cloud technologies to build a career with Canonical and drive the success with those leveraging Ubuntu and open source products. If you have an affinity for open source development and a passion for technology, then you will enjoy working with some of the best people in the industry at Canonical.
   

  

**Engineering Manager**
 The BootStack team designs, builds, and operates modern distributed systems on private infrastructure for customers. From Kubernetes to OpenStack and everything in-between, you'll be working with the latest technology in a fast-paced engineering environment. As a Cloud Engineering Manager for the BootStack team, you will be responsible for managing the engineers that oversee day-to-day Managed Service of customer environments, including customer service management, managed services operations and consistent product improvement engineering. Collaboration with customers, product engineering, and operations is critical to success.
   

  

**As an Engineering Manager you will:**
* Manage a growing engineering team to optimise the quality and velocity of both development and operations
* Identify and measure team health indicators
* Implement disciplined engineering and operations processes
* Represent the BootStack team with respect to stakeholders, customers, and external teams
* Ensure proper team focus on priorities, milestones, and deliverables
* Work to meet service level agreements with customer deployments around the globe
* Deliver quality managed services in a consistent, timely manner


**The successful Engineering Manager candidate will have:**
* Bachelors (or equivalent) education in a technology field
* Proven track record of professional experience of either software delivery using Python, Go, C, C++, Java, or similar and/or managing operations teams
* Proven experience with OpenStack
* Demonstrated strong commitment to testing methodologies and maintainable code quality
* Experience with Linux system administration, Ubuntu/Debian a plus
* Strong communication and cooperation skills
* Experience with agile software development methodologies
* Experience working in and managing distributed teams
* Technical aptitude for understanding complex distributed systems
* Experience with cloud topologies and technologies
* Travel to team and company events and customer meetings, roughly 20% or less


**What we offer you**
 We consider geographical location, experience, and performance in shaping compensation worldwide. We revisit compensation annually (and more often for graduates and associates) to ensure we recognise outstanding performance. In addition to base pay, we offer a performance-driven annual bonus. We provide all team members with additional benefits, which reflect our values and ideals. We balance our programs to meet local needs and ensure fairness globally.
   

  

* Distributed work environment with twice-yearly team sprints in person - we've been working remotely since 2004!
* Personal learning and development budget of USD 2,000 per year
* Annual compensation review
* Recognition rewards
* Annual holiday leave
* Maternity and paternity leave
* Employee Assistance Programme
* Opportunity to travel to new locations to meet colleagues from your team and others
* Priority Pass for travel and travel upgrades for long haul company events


**About Canonical**
 Canonical is a pioneering tech firm that is at the forefront of the global move to open source. As the company that publishes Ubuntu, one of the most important open source projects and the platform for AI, IoT and the cloud, we are changing the world on a daily basis. We recruit on a global basis and set a very high standard for people joining the company. We expect excellence - in order to succeed, we need to be the best at what we do.
   

  

 Canonical has been a remote-first company since its inception in 2004. Work at Canonical is a step into the future, and will challenge you to think differently, work smarter, learn new skills, and raise your game. Canonical provides a unique window into the world of 21st-century digital business.
   

  

**Canonical is an equal opportunity employer**
 We are proud to foster a workplace free from discrimination. Diversity of experience, perspectives, and background create a better work environment and better products. Whatever your identity, we will give your application fair consideration.

title: Engineering Manager
description:
* Application Deadline: April 30, 2025
* Hybrid


**Job Description**
**What we do at Detectify**
 Imagine leading a team that directly fortifies the digital world. As our Engineering Manager for the Discovery and Assessment team, DnA, you'll be at the helm of building cutting-edge discovery and vulnerability assessment products in our eventdriven architecture inspired heavily by Domain driven design patterns. Empowering our customers to proactively secure their external attack surfaces. If you're passionate about driving technical excellence and leading high-performing teams, join our nerdy, warm, and humble culture of high achievers.
   

  

 Detectify offers cybersecurity solutions that combine human ingenuity with automation. We offer a cloud-based cyber security platform that streamlines asset discovery and vulnerability assessments for Product Security and AppSec teams. We believe that the fear of cyber threats should never stand in the way of digital greatness.
   

  

**What You'll Get to Do:**
 Your role will be to lead and mentor a diverse engineering team, providing technical guidance and actively participating in key technical discussions, while also contributing to hands-on development as needed. You will have the unique opportunity to shape and develop one of our critical product teams: the Discovery and Assessment team
   

  

**People Leadership**
* You will champion a high performing team culture, motivating individuals to contribute their best while providing constructive feedback when needed
* You will create a challenging yet supportive environment where team members are empowered to learn from facing complex problems and take ownership of their professional development.
* You will Strategically build and lead high performance team to deliver innovative product solutions that drive growth, ensuring Detectify remains at the cutting edge of the industry


**Technical leadership**
* You'll collaborate closely with the Product Manager to set and guide the team's technical direction, ensuring alignment with product outcomes.
* You'll work hand-in-hand with senior team members to establish a coherent technical vision and strategy, contributing to an overall engineering strategy, that empowers the team to achieve its goals in a fast paced environment.
* You will with the team translate deep technical expertise in cybersecurity into product solutions that yields real business value


**Strategic leadership**
* You'll take ownership of product delivery, the team consistently meets expectations in quality, security, and overall results.
* You'll also proactively communicate progress and challenges with the broader organization, stepping in to resolve impediments whenever necessary to keep the team on track.
* You will align team goals with the company's objectives, develop and implement long-term strategies for success, and identify opportunities for innovation and improvement.


**Skills & Requirements**
 Skills & Requirements:
   

  

* You have several years of experience in technical leadership, preferably within a Saas or a cybersecurity company
* You have a proven track record of building high-performing teams that have driven product innovation and market growth.
* You love to work in a collaborative environment bringing out the best of everyone
* You have a background in backend development with solid experience from API development, event based architectures and domain driven design as well as solid experience from cloud first environments.
* Experience with pair programming and mob programming will be highly valued.
* You have experience with a range of agile technologies and the ability and experience to experiment with new methodologies and tools in a team.


**Skills & Requirements**
 Skills & Requirements:
   

  

* You have several years of experience in technical leadership, preferably within a Saas or a cybersecurity company
* You have a proven track record of building high-performing teams that have driven product innovation and market growth.
* You love to work in a collaborative environment bringing out the best of everyone
* You have a background in backend development with solid experience from API development, event based architectures and domain driven design as well as solid experience from cloud first environments.
* Experience with pair programming and mob programming will be highly valued.
* You have experience with a range of agile technologies and the ability and experience to experiment with new methodologies and tools in a team.

title: Senior Systems Engineer
description:
**Hungry, Humble, Honest, with Heart.**
**The Opportunity**
 Do you love discovering customers’ business challenges and crafting unique solutions for them? Are you ready for an opportunity to transform the way companies work? If you have a passion for Enterprise Cloud Technology and a knack for helping customers understand them; we want to talk to you!
   

  

 Nutanix (NTNX) is looking for a passionate and enthusiastic Senior Systems Engineer (SE) who will act as a trusted advisor to our customer’s beginning as a presales activity while aiding the customer’s transformational journey through the adoption of our solutions portfolio. Your primary responsibility is to partner with the sales team and provide technical knowledge around Nutanix solutions to our customers and prospects. You’ll provide technical expertise through sales presentations, product demonstrations, and guide prospects through technical evaluations (POCs) which are critical to the deal's success. Additionally, you will work with various teams to resolve customer concerns, escalate product issues, and serve as an ambassador for our brand.
   

  

**About The Team**
 Our Systems Engineering & Solution Sales organization is made up of 800+ customer-focused technical sales professionals who are responsible for identifying and matching technology opportunities with the customer’s business issues and objectives, as well as channel partner training and enablement. This team also acts in a consultative fashion and is looked to as an expert in their field by the Nutanix sales, customer success, business partners, and customers.
   

  

**Your Role**
* Demonstrate features and articulate benefits of Nutanix solutions to influence customer’s purchases to drive business transformation
* Size and configure Nutanix solutions
* Navigate & build long-term relationships with customers & be seen and treated as their trusted/valued resource
* Communicate customer feedback into the Nutanix ecosystem
* Partner with sales counterparts in developing account plans, customer persona coverage models and proposal creation to recommend and design solutions based on Nutanix offerings
* Collaborate with the wider presales team and obtain technical wins in the shortest


 and most professional manner
   

  

* Manage complex accounts and larger sales transactions
* Be a subject matter expert in one or more Nutanix products
* Be a subject matter expert in one vertical market such as FSI, Telco, Healthcare,


 Public Sector, etc.
   

  

**What You Will Bring**
* 6 to 9 years of experience in a customer-facing technical role with 3 to 5 years’


 experience as a Presales Engineer
   

  

* Hands-on technical aptitude, and the agility to adapt according to market demands.
* Team player with cross-functional collaboration experience.
* Analytical approach to solving complex problems, with the ability to clearly describe


 the situation and suggest a solution strategy.
   

  

* Excellent communication (written and verbal) and presentation skills in English.
* Ability to manage multiple projects, determine project urgency, and execute detailed action plans.
* Highest level of personal and professional ethics and integrity.
* A desire to learn and be challenged, and continuously strive for excellence.
* Ability to perform and execute a flawless proof of concept, which at times will require


 lifting up to 50 lb servers within the datacenter in order to rack and stack the
   

  

 hardware the proof of concept will be executed on.
   

  

* Presales experience in data center and cloud technologies such as storage,


 virtualization, and automation frameworks with a solid level of expertise in technical
   

  

 specifications to sell Nutanix products and services.
   

  

* Subject matter expertise in one or more relevant technology disciplines to establish


 credibility with technical leaders.
   

  

* Ability to provide mentorship for new hires and peer colleagues.

title: Senior BI Consultant
description:
Är du en fena på Power BI &/ Qlik och älskar att omvandla data till insikter? Vill du jobba i en flexibel miljö där du får stort ansvar och frihet? Då kanske du är vår nästa 
 **Senior BI Consultant** 
 !
 



  





 Hos oss på 
 **Stormyran** 
 , ett ungt bolag inom 
 **Finance & Data** 
 , värdesätter vi frihet och eget ansvar. Vi tror att 
 **de bästa resultaten kommer när människor får jobba på sina egna villkor** 
 . Därför erbjuder vi en 
 **flexibel arbetsplats** 
 , där du kan arbeta 
 **remote eller från något av våra kontor i Stockholm, Falun** 
 eller
 **Bollnäs** 
 .
 



  





**Vad kommer du att göra?** 




  





 Som 
 **BI-konsult** 
  hos oss kommer du att:
 


* Designa, utveckla och underhålla 
 **dashboards och rapporter i Power BI** 
  som hjälper verksamheter att fatta smarta beslut.
* Arbeta med 
 **datamodellering, DAX och SQL** 
  för att optimera prestanda och skapa robusta analyslösningar.
* Samarbeta med kunder och kollegor för att förstå affärsbehov och omvandla dem till tydliga och användbara rapporter.
* Bidra med din expertis kring 
 **best practices och strategier** 
  för BI-lösningar.
* Om du har erfarenhet av 
 **Qlik** 
 , även få jobba med Qlik-lösningar för våra kunder.



  





**Vem är du?** 



* Du har minst 
 **3 års erfarenhet** 
  av att arbeta med
 **BI** 
  och 
 **datavisualisering** 
 .
* Du har goda kunskaper inom 
 **DAX, datamodellering och SQL** 
 .
* Relevant utbildning eller certifiering.
* Erfarenhet av 
 **Qlik (t.ex. Qlik Sense, QlikView, Qlik Cloud) är meriterande** 
  men inget krav.
* Du trivs i en roll där du 
 **får ta ansvar, driva projekt framåt och kommunicera med både tekniska och icke- tekniska stakeholders** 
 .
* Du är nyfiken och gillar att 
 **lösa problem och hitta kreativa lösningar** 
 .
* *Extra* 
*meriterande* 
 om du har erfarenhet och förståelse för verksamhet och kan sätta dig in i olika affärs-modeller och processer för att kunna agera bollplank för kunden utanför det rent tekniska.



  





**Vad erbjuder vi?** 



* **Flexibilitet** 
  – jobba remote eller från kontoret, du bestämmer.
* **Generösa förmåner och arbetsvillkor** 
  – vi tar hand om våra anställda.
* **Stora utvecklingsmöjligheter** 
  – hos oss finns det alltid utrymme att växa och påverka.
* **Ett ungt, framåtlutat team** 
  där vi värdesätter samarbete och delad kunskap.
* **En roll där du verkligen gör skillnad** 
  – dina insikter hjälper våra kunder att fatta bättre beslut.



  





 Låter det intressant? Hör av dig så pratar vi vidare!

title: In-house Search Lead
description:
As a pioneer global remote-first tech company with a product that inspires people globally, we attract a huge number of applicants to our organisation. We have created a hiring process that is totally unique empowering our business based Hiring Leadership team to lead talent selection. Our Talent Science team ensures that our processes are effective and that the business is able to hire high performing talent. This is an exceptional opportunity to join a team that is changing the way an organisation hires connecting performance outcomes to hiring.
   

  

 Our Talent Science team has a mission to ensure that we follow objective, scientifically rigorous and efficient processes to select the very best new colleagues regardless of location, culture or background. We work closely with our key stakeholders to ensure that decisions are being made in the right way and that our hiring model supports the section of world class talent.
   

  

 Our team works closely with the business to oversee the hiring process and encourage best practice whilst offering an expert viewpoint on talent assessments. We are not recruiters; it's about the science of talent and performance, raising awareness and offering deep analytical insights across the business to enable them to select the best talent available from our global talent pool.
   

  

 We have a brand new opportunity for an experienced search consultant to teach our senior executives how to source talent for the open senior leadership positions in their departments. Your key skills will be:
   

  

* Professional experience of identifying and approaching senior leadership talent from either a professional search firm or from an in-house search function, working within the Technology industry.
* Experience of training senior stakeholders the art of headhunting.
* Excellent knowledge tools used to identify future talent including market mapping.
* Ability to interview candidates using behavioural interviewing techniques (competency based and psychometric assessments).
* Strong analytical problem solving ability to identify trends and patterns from data.
* An exceptional academic background including a Bachelors or Masters degree in a Psychology or people based subject, with a good level of Maths at High school.


 Location: EMEA - Home based
   

  

 The role entails
   

  

* Develop a search strategy for our business, ensuring processes enable headhunted talent to move smoothly through the pipeline.
* Coach our senior leadership teams to drive hiring outcomes, enabling them to become expert at approaching and attracting exceptional talent for their management and leadership positions.
* Drive talent analytics to provide our business with real-time insight, partnering with the business to help them move through their hiring processes efficiently.
* Conduct in-depth behavioural talent interviews providing considerable insights into motivations and behaviours.
* Build key relationships with global stakeholders to ensure we deliver against our hiring agenda, closely monitoring hiring activities, driving results and ensuring that there is consistency in our operational processes
* Consider our employer brand and how our interactions with a candidate impacts their experience
* Seek continuous improvement on hiring processes and outcomes.
* Bring a passion for diversity and inclusion, ensuring we remove unconscious bias from our hiring process and ensuring our sourcing strategy underpins this.


 What we are looking for in you
   

  

* Professional experience of headhunting from a reputable search firm or in-house search function, with an informed opinion of strategies and experience of successfully sourcing senior talent in the Technology industry.
* Experience of working with senior stakeholders, creating learning programmes to develop their ability to successfully identify and engage with passive talent.
* Exposure or appreciation of psychometric assessments.
* Experience of conducting behavioural, competency based interviews with the ability to train stakeholders and advise on how to get the best out of an interview.
* An exceptional academic background including a Bachelors or Masters degree in a Psychology or people based subject and a good level of Maths from High School.
* Strong analytical problem solving ability to identify trends and patterns from data and proficient with LinkedIn talent modules..
* A high level of personal organisation to work remotely and be effective.
* Willingness to travel to company events 2-4 times a year, for up to two weeks each.


**Other Skills You May Bring**
* Experience of more advanced analytical and statistical analysis to interrogate data.
* Exposure to the following tools: Greenhouse ATS, Thomas International and DISC profiling.
* Psychometric validity and reliability metrics.


 What we offer colleagues
   

  

 We consider geographical location, experience, and performance in shaping compensation worldwide. We revisit compensation annually (and more often for graduates and associates) to ensure we recognise outstanding performance. In addition to base pay, we offer a performance-driven annual bonus. We provide all team members with additional benefits, which reflect our values and ideals. We balance our programs to meet local needs and ensure fairness globally.
   

  

* Distributed work environment with twice-yearly team sprints in person
* Personal learning and development budget of USD 2,000 per year
* Annual compensation review
* Recognition rewards
* Annual holiday leave
* Maternity and paternity leave
* Employee Assistance Programme
* Opportunity to travel to new locations to meet colleagues
* Priority Pass, and travel upgrades for long haul company events


**About Canonical**
 Canonical is a pioneering tech firm at the forefront of the global move to open source. As the company that publishes Ubuntu, one of the most important open source projects and the platform for AI, IoT and the cloud, we are changing the world on a daily basis. We recruit on a global basis and set a very high standard for people joining the company. We expect excellence - in order to succeed, we need to be the best at what we do. Canonical has been a remote-first company since its inception in 2004. Working here is a step into the future, and will challenge you to think differently, work smarter, learn new skills, and raise your game.
   

  

 Canonical is an equal opportunity employer
   

  

 We are proud to foster a workplace free from discrimination. Diversity of experience, perspectives, and background create a better work environment and better products. Whatever your identity, we will give your application fair consideration.

title: Information Technology Support Specialist
description:
**Do you want to be at the heart of a dynamic IT environment, driving both support excellence and cloud innovation?** 




  





 We're looking for a versatile IT professional to join our team as an IT Support Specialist based in our Head Office in Stockholm. This is a role with global impact and is perfect for someone who enjoys providing top-tier support to users while also contributing to the development and management of our cloud infrastructure. We are currently a team of five people with a high level of expertise in a range of IT areas. You'll be a key contributor in ensuring our Global IT operations, with opportunities to grow your skills in both support and cloud technologies. You will have the chance to work closely with our security team and learn best practices for building a strong, ISO27001 compliant infrastructure. You will also be challenged in providing support for Enterprise Business IT solutions, as the team works closely with the Business Information Solution team who is responsible for the ERP, Data/BI, CRM, Developer productivity tooling etc.
 



  





**As an IT Support Specialist, you will be responsible for** 
 :
 



  




* Providing exceptional IT support to all company users, managing the IT service desk, and delivering on-site support for our Stockholm office. Analyzing and prioritizing incidents to ensure quick and effective resolution, using emotional intelligence to understand the business impact of IT issues and communicating clearly with stakeholders
* Maintaining and managing office IT functions in Stockholm, local support including conference rooms, digital screens, and devices.
* Contributing to the development, implementation, and troubleshooting of various IT services and functions, with a focus on Microsoft Azure services.
* Administering Entra ID to manage identities and access for internal and external users. Administrating Intune to manage and secure client devices, ensuring compliance with company security policies Working with Azure platform services like Sentinel and Defender to monitor and protect identities and client endpoints.
* Contribute to critical operations, such as for cloud/on-premises server and network infrastructure. Participating in the automation and continuous improvement of our cloud deployment and operations processes.



  





**How will your first 3-6 months look like?** 




  





 The first few months will be focused on IT support, where you will be faced with a wide range of tasks and challenges that will help you understand the concept of our infrastructure and the company. Once you feel more comfortable working in the team and have gained skills, you will be able to join and lead the technical troubleshooting, development and implementation of various IT services or functions that the company needs.
 



  





**This role will offer you:** 




  





 The opportunity to work with a broad range of technologies, including Active Directory, Google Workspace, Office 365, Windows/Linux operating systems, Microsoft Azure, Amazon Cloud, Jira, Confluence, Lucidchart, PowerShell, Intune, Fortinet products, and Slack. A dynamic environment where you can learn and develop your skills, particularly in Microsoft Azure and security infrastructure.
 



  





 A mix of support and engineering tasks, providing variety and challenge in your daily work and the ability to work both independently and collaboratively within a high-performing team.
 



  





**What we are looking for:** 




  





 We are seeking a motivated IT professional with a couple of years of experience in IT technologies and support, possessing a strong understanding of IT operations. The ideal candidate will be familiar with relevant platforms and software, demonstrate excellent troubleshooting and proactive problem-solving skills, and communicate effectively in English (both written and verbal). A customer-centric mindset with a commitment to outstanding service is essential. This role requires the ability to analyze and prioritize incidents effectively, make business-aligned decisions, and perform well under pressure. Experience managing Microsoft Intune and Entra ID is required, along with knowledge of automation tools and scripting (e.g., Azure CLI, PowerShell, Terraform) and modern device management principles. A passion for cloud technologies, a collaborative spirit, and strong organizational skills are highly valued.
 



  





**Why join us?** 




  




* Be part of a supportive environment where you are empowered to take on challenges and make a real impact.
* Access ongoing learning opportunities and professional development, particularly in cloud technologies and identity management.
* Enjoy a company culture that values innovation, teamwork, and a healthy work-life balance.

title: Mid-Senior Full Stack Engineer
description:
**About Sinch**
 Sinch is pioneering the way the world communicates. More than 150,000 businesses — including Google, Uber, Paypal, Visa, Tinder, and many others — rely on Sinch's Customer Communications Cloud to power engaging customer experiences through mobile messaging, voice, and email.
   

  

 Whether you need to verify users or craft omnichannel campaigns, Sinch makes it easy. Our AI-infused Super Network, APIs, and applications ensure you can connect with your customers reliably and securely, at every step of their journey.
   

  

 At Sinch we "Dream Big", "Win Together", "Keep it simple", and "Make it Happen". These values are our foundation!
   

  

**Description**
 Develop, architect and scale the core infrastructure for Sinch's web applications. Be part of in a small cross functional team that sets its own objectives and goals with responsibility for every stage of product development life cycle from planning and design to implementation, testing, deployment, monitoring and maintenance, you build It you run it.
   

  

 Your work will be focused around the common platform used to that makes up the core of the product line; The code you write will be consumed by used by many different teams and is a key enabler in the product line. You will solve problems across the enterprise, focusing not only on how to deliver a great product today but setting the foundations for the future.
   

  

**Tech Stack:** 
 NodeJS, Java, React, Typescript
   

  

**Requirements**
* A strong software engineering background
* In-depth knowledge of the web platform and ecosystem
* Expertise in modern front-end technologies.
* Solid track record working with Typescript in a professional or open-source setting.
* Experience building services on the backend
* Fluency in English


**Good to have**
* Experience using design systems
* Experience making architectural decisions that have high impact
* Experience with Web components and the latest Web APIs
* Experience with AWS, Kubernetes and other cloud native technologies


**Our Hiring Process**
 We are committed to ensuring a recruitment process that is fair, objective, consistent, and inclusive. Our approach includes structured, competency-based interviews designed to evaluate your skills, experience, and qualifications relevant to the role. At times, we may include a data-driven assessment to enhance our hiring success and identify candidates likely to excel.
   

  

 We believe in a two-way process and encourage you to ask questions throughout the journey. If this role isn't what you're looking for, please explore the other opportunities listed on our career page: https://www.sinch.com/careers/. No matter who you are, we hope you find an exciting path forward - hopefully with us!

title: Data & Analytics Management Consultants - Graduates (Stockholm or Gothenburg)
description:
**Do you want to jumpstart your career within Data & Analytics?** 




  





 Are you passionate about digitalization and innovation and thrive in a fast-moving environment? At Capgemini Invent’s Data & Analytics practice, we help organizations utilize advanced analytics, AI, Gen AI, and intelligent automation technologies to transform data into valuable insights and enable strategic, real-time business decision-making.
 



  





 We are currently recruiting inventive and driven graduates to join our Data & Analytics practice at our offices in Stockholm and Gothenburg.
 



  





**What can you expect?** 




  




* Driving real change together with our clients with diversity, transparency and sustainability as key values
* Development of data-driven solutions and business models, helping organizations transform data into valuable insights
* Innovative projects and international teams as well as successful growth in digital future topics at the interface between business, strategy, data and IT
* A corporate culture based on values that has been lived for many years
* Transparent career prospects and further training opportunities within a global network of experts
* The person we wish to invite to join our mission:
* Holds a Master’s degree with a business, technical or information technology focus, ideally combined with real life experience
* Graduating during 2025, or recently graduated and holds 0-1 year of relevant work experience.
* Enjoy the combination of tech understanding, strategic analysis and implementation work as well as having the ability to think conceptually and analytically
* A proactive mindset, efficient way of working, high degree of reliability and a strong team spirit
* Quickly grasps client business matters and is passionate about future trends.
* Holds excellent communication skills in Swedish and English.
* In addition, international and professional experiences as well as extracurricular activities are seen as meriting.



  





 We welcome to join in Fall 2025, and you will be located in office in Stockholm or Gothenburg, but with readiness to travel and work on projects at our client sites.
 **If you have graduated already, we you are welcome to join already in spring 2025.** 




  





**Does this sound like a great opportunity, are you ready to get the future you want?** 




  





 Seats are filled on an ongoing basis; we encourage you to apply as soon as possible! Apply by sending your CV and application in English and official University transcripts and High School grades. Please state clearly in your application your expected graduation date and to which office(s) you are applying. Please note that only complete applications are considered.
 



  





**About Capgemini Invent and the Group** 




  





 As the digital innovation, design and transformation brand of the Capgemini Group, Capgemini Invent enables CxOs to envision and shape the future of their businesses. Located in over 30 studios and more than 60 offices around the world, it comprises a 12,500+ strong team of strategists, data scientists, product and experience designers, brand experts and technologists who develop new digital services, products, experiences and business models for sustainable growth.
 



  





 Capgemini Invent is an integral part of Capgemini, a global business and technology transformation partner, helping organizations to accelerate their dual transition to a digital and sustainable world, while creating tangible impact for enterprises and society. It is a responsible and diverse group of 340,000 team members in more than 50 countries. With its strong over 55-year heritage, Capgemini is trusted by its clients to unlock the value of technology to address the entire breadth of their business needs. It delivers end-to-end services and solutions leveraging strengths from strategy and design to engineering, all fueled by its market leading capabilities in AI, cloud and data, combined with its deep industry expertise and partner ecosystem. The Group reported 2023 global revenues of €22.5 billion.
 



  





 We are very much looking forward to hearing from you! Read more about us at: https://www.capgemini.com/se-en/service/invent/
